But honestly, I find that they fit so well around my ears that I really don't need to use the noise cancelling feature that much.  Just the fit makes it noise cancelling.  The bluetooth connection is quick and there is an included audio cable for when you might run out of battery.  These reportedly get 30 hours of battery life on playback, but I have yet to test that out.  If this is the case, then these headphones are far superior (IMHO) to the higher priced headphones that have less battery life.  Plus, if the rechargeable battery dies on these, then I'm not going to be as concerned with buying another set as I would be if I had purchased the higher priced headphones.

As for looks?  They look great, ear cups are soft, headband is padded, and they aren't tight on my head or my ears.  Sure, maybe the metal colored plastic is a little cheap, but I'm not expecting high dollar features for this price point.  And yes, maybe the button on the right to skip ahead and back is a little clicky, but I can deal with it.  Oh, and yes...that clicky skip forward/back button is NOT the volume up/down you might think when you first put them on (I thought it was).  Just so you know.  I cannot find a way to reprogram it.  That is a weird feature.  On wireless headphones, I would think you'd put the volume buttons on the headphones instead of a button to skip songs.  I am concerned, however, that the leatherette headband and earcups will be susceptible to tearing over time due to use, but I'm sure I can find a cover or a replacement and fix that problem straightaway.

Overall, I'm happy I bought these.  I really bought them for travel.  I have a pair of Beats Pro DJ headphones with the aluminum ear cups and they weren't cheap, so to take them on the road with me makes me nervous that they'll get messed up from going in and out of my bag all the time (in fact, that has already happened GRRRR).  Granted, I don't want these to get messed up either, but if it happens then I didn't pay that much for them, and the sting will not be so bad.

author: S. Snyder
title: These Are Amazing Headphones
content:
I purchased these Cowin E7 ANC Bluetooth headphones in mid June and have been using them regularly since then.  I own a fairly large number of headphones, both over ear and in ear.  I'm kind of a sound geek and I enjoy many genres of music as well as talk radio and podcasts.  Let me summarize why I consider these E7's to be my best headphone purchase in a very long time.

Right out of the box, these phones look amazing!  I ordered them in black; they are sleek and shiny and the overall look is awesome.  I put them on my head, and wow.............I was struck right away by how comfortable they are.  These are without question my most comfortable over ear headphones, and I have around six pairs of over ear phones.  I've fallen asleep with them on in bed, and several hours later when I wake up, they are comfortable and my ears are not sore or hot.  Some headphones have that effect of soreness after several hours; I've not experienced that with the Cowin E7's.

The sound on these headphones is awesome.  I don't consider myself an audiophile.......I do consider myself very picky.  If they don't sound good, I don't use them.  I listen to tons of music and the E7's sound great with all genres.  The bass is strong and punchy........I don't consider it to be overdone or obnoxious the way some phones are!

I love the noise cancelling on these E7's!  I would say it takes away ambient noise in the high 80's percentile and that's pretty darn good.  The bass remains solid with ANC employed.  I have not used them in an airplane yet, but I have used them around white noise fans.  I can tell you that the fan noise all but disappears and I can tell from experience that they will be very effective on airplanes.  Considering their comfort, great sound and ANC ability, these will be my go-to travel headphones in the friendly skies.

The Bluetooth range on the E7's is outstanding.  I get 40 plus feet........sometimes almost 50 with these.  Bottom line......I can go from nearly end to end in my home without drop off and I can easily leave my phone on the dining room table and move through the house doing housework without issues.  My home is about 1500 square feet, to give you some idea.

Now let's talk battery life.  I'll just say that on a full charge, I have used the E7's for 7 hours and I was still almost 100 percent.  That may sound too good to be true, and you may wonder if by making that claim, perhaps I work for Cowin.  That is truly my experience thus far, and I work for a Child Abuse Intervention Center........I don't work for Cowin.  I also want to say that pairing the E7's was super easy........they now pair immediately with my iPhone 8.

You may have read great reviews in the past and then after ordering the product, you were somewhat disappointed.  I can tell you that I worried about that as well.  Let me just say that for under 60 dollars, these phones are like gold to me!  I love them and I would suggest that you will love them too.  Take the plunge and go with the E7's.

Scott Snyder
Oregon

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great value headphones - excellent warranty and customer service
content:
I've had these headphones for the better part of a year now and I absolutely love them!  I try to keep reviews short, so here are a few key points:

- They are VERY comfortable. I'm a big guy with a large head and they sit on my head and ears comfortably.
- Excellent sound quality and noise-canceling ability. I used these in a crowded open office with lots of loud people all around me and it did the job. Note that loud things can still make their way through, but also note that these are not a pair of behemoth $400 headphones
- GREAT battery life. I could go through most of a week of heavy use without needing any charging.
- Lastly, EXCELLENT customer service. My headphones ended up breaking along a hinge after 9 months of usage, and when I contacted their customer service email address I received a reply in less than 24 hours. They told me about their 18-month warranty and quickly replaced the headphones via Amazon Prime. I was very grateful to have it resolved so quickly.

Overall, if you're looking for a great pair of comfortable noise-canceling headphones without spending an ungodly amount of money, this is a great product for you.

author: donald meyers
title: Volume Deficiencies - BT goes in and out
content: The Good: The noise cancellation is great. It does a good job of blocking out the everyday hum drum noises. The sound quality is also superb. Very full detailed sound and the battery life is great. The Bad: The overall volume capacity is very unimpressive to say the least. My $13 Bluetooth headphones get louder than these. My cheap headphones will go as loud as the phone will allow and you can turn it up past what the phone will allow, on the headphones themselves. These WILL not get loud at all or let you turn them up on the set themselves, past what the phone will allow. The Bluetooth also disconnects frequently. For long periods of time and for short intervals, so you often you hear every other syllable of a word. Very annoying. Very disappointing for the price.

author: Lois Laurent
title: While the sound quality of these headphones is adequate, ...
content:
UPDATE:  Based on my review below, the seller reached out to me and provided a new set of "optimized" headphones. I'll upgrade my rating to 3 stars only because of the customer service response.
While they do get an A for customer service, these new "optimized" headphones still do not provide any significant noise cancellation.  For comparison, I sat in my living room with my tv on normal volume.  I put on the headphones, but did not turn them on.  I could still hear the tv about as well as before.  I turned on the noise cancelling function and literally heard zero reduction in the tv volume.  The headphones were NOT paired to the tv.  I then got out those expensive ones my husband is so fond of and repeated the same steps.  His reduced the tv volume by about 25-30%.  I repeated the same experiment with both sets of headphones -- this time to listen to music on an Apple device.  Same results -- the expensive headphones cancelled out a lot of the background (tv) noise while these did not.  For the price, these are not bad headphones -- they just provide nowhere near the noise cancellation I've come to expect.  Disclaimer -- the husband who is so selfish with his expensive headphones tells me I hear noises only dogs can hear.  That might be the whole issue.

################

While the sound quality of these headphones is adequate, the noise cancelling is almost nonexistent.  I bought these because my husband was tired of sharing his expensive ones and I was not looking to spend another $300+.  I guess I got what I paid for.

author: KT
title: Great Battery Life
content:
I love the battery life on these headphones. I've owned bluetooth headphones before this is one of the best for the price hands down. The call quality is alright so I've been told. Going on the subway, you can't hear anyone blasting it on the loudest setting. Transit takes me about an hour a day and I listen to maybe 10 hours aside from round-trip transit so I charge it maybe once a week if that, and I'm a good to go.

They're super comfortable. The metal smudges easily, but a shirt will clean it, it isn't even noticeable. The pairing of bluetooth is next to immediate and it isn't complicated process to link up and turn on. If/when they break I'll probably order these again. Honestly I don't see them breaking any time soon for a couple of years due to how well they're built.

Definitely recommend!

author: Lifestooshort
title: Works well but not excellent.
content: I use these at work or at home when I am studying. They are the only pair I have ever owned so not sure if maybe my expectations are too high but the noise cancelling isn’t the greatest. You can still hear everything going on around you. My ears hurt after wearing them for a bit and have to take them off for a few minutes. The Bluetooth works well and when I’m listening to music as low as it goes (I wish it went lower bc it’s quietist isn’t that quiet) I can’t hear anything else around me so the noise cancelling works great then. For what you pay though I’d say these are an excellent buy. I’ve never had the expensive kind though so not sure if they cancel noise any better when not listening to music and I don’t know if my ears are just sensitive and any pair would hurt after a while. The battery definitely lasts a long time as I hardly every charge them and I use them every day.

author: R Ward
title: Far exceeds my expectations
content:
The first thing that impressed me was the packaging. Well done. Once charged I set out to test these. First thing I noticed is the comfort of these on my head. Well padded with controls and sswitches easy to get to. Paired to several different devices easily and all on the first try. No issues at all.

I bought these to replace a pair Bose NC headphones that were stolen. I was gun shy tonspend a lot of money on a new pair for fear they would get stolen. I have owned other headphones like beats, JBL and Sennheiser. The sound from these headphones is excellent. Bass and midrange are great in listening to music, movies and audio books.

Construction of the headphones appears to excellent. Obviously time will tell on this. The pair of Beats headphones I had looked great also. The end life of those was not so good. I paid a good deal less for these but they feel better than other brands I have used. For now I am impressed with the construction, appearance, sound and packaging of these.

author: Tim
title: Amazing Customer Service!
content:
UPDATE 8/21/19:  The replacement headset (OUCOMI Active Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones) that I got back in September 2018 to replace my broken Cowin set conked out.  The right ear got staticky and then went out completely within the same day.  Thank goodness I had the unopened replacement Cowin set that Laurence (see 9/10/18 update) had sent me.  I really do love these. They are a little tighter on the ears than other headphones I've owned, but for sound and noise cancellation, there are none better.  I only hope they last longer than the last ones I bought (and that Laurence replaced), but again, their customer service is over and above any I've dealt with for any product, not just headphones.

UPDATE 9/10/18:  Out of the blue I was contacted via email by Laurence from Cowin. Unprompted, he was letting me know that he'd read my review (see below) and that the headphones were still under warranty.  He offered to send a new pair (I didn't even have to send the broken ones back), or they would refund my money if I'd already gotten a new pair. I opted for a new pair, and the day after Labor Day (five calendar days after his initial contact), I got my brand new pair in the mail. Didn't even have to give my address, credit card, etc. They sent it based on my initial purchase.  Never heard of a company that stood behind its product like that, actually seeking out the customer to make good on a warranty.  AMAZING customer service and a product I can now heartily recommend.

--
ORIGINAL POST: I bought these 10 months ago. The noise cancellation was the best, but they've always hurt my ears a little from the pressure they put on them because of the fact that they sit on a good portion of your actual ear rather than over it. Today I was working, and out of nowhere I just felt a pop.  The right earphone came apart (unglued?) for no obvious reason.  The headphones go from my desk to my head and nowhere else; no rough treatment; never been dropped. I don't even adjust them. They've been at the same (minimum) adjustment since the day I got them pretty much.

author: Lucas Jon
title: Great headphones - price can’t be beat.
content:
Wow. These are absolutely phenomenal headphones. I bought them about a year and a half ago and I use them all the time. I had a pair of on ear headphones from a no-name brand a few years ago and, while they served their purpose, they were not impressively loud and became a little aggravating on the ears after a while. These sit very comfortably on my head while I do chores around the house or yard work etc. I run a mobile auto detailing business in my spare time and use them for that as well.  I don’t have a particularly large head and they fit nicely, but I imagine they would be better for someone with a big noggin. If I find myself looking down for too long they will start to slip off my head. I wouldn’t even attempt to do any kind of cardio with these. Weightlifting, sure but running - no. They are too lose and when using the noise canceling feature, any excess movement makes it crackle.

The noise canceling is pretty decent. It’s not Bose quality but it’s plenty powerful to muffle a mower, vacuum or grinder. It almost entirely mutes plane noise. Like I mentioned, it doesn’t take much jostling to make it crackle, but if it becomes too annoying I just turn the NC off.

Sound quality is also pretty good. Depending on the app/song I’m listening to, it can get EXTREMELY loud.  So much so that I have to turn it down - which is saying something because I listen to my music on full blast most of the time. Sound quality is marginally better with the NC on, but marginally louder with NC off.

Build construction is solid enough. Kind of feels like a few steps up from just cheap plastic. Don’t get me wrong - it IS cheap plastic but it presents itself well. Pads are very soft and so far the body has been durable. I’ve dropped these on the ground a few times and, while they are covered in scratches, they are still performing fabulously.

Finally, and very importantly, the battery life on these is UNPRECEDENTED. I mean I will use these for hours a day for like 2 weeks in a row before even thinking about charging them. I think they advertise 16 hours, but no joke I have probably used these for 40+ hours between charges and they still weren’t dead. Unbelievable. There is also a widget for the iPhone but I’ve found it to be entirely inaccurate.

Bluetooth connection is lightning fast and has superb distance. In an open field I’ve used them further than 80’ from my phone.

Gripes: I have only a few.
My biggest gripe is the piss poor Siri support. There is not a designated Siri button which sucks. And it wouldn’t be so bad, but there is about a 4 second delay between Siri activation and the prompt to begin speaking. I hope they addressed this with the E8’s.

There is an LED on the command switch that never turns off and is quite bright. Also not a huge deal, but it bothers my wife if I try to wear them in bed.

Lastly, the hinges of the earpieces have become a little squeaky and loose after a year. Overall, these are minute gripes that I actually had to think about to put in here.

Overall these are a fantastic set of headphones and have earned their 5-stars from me. I bought another product from Cowin and had to get in touch with their customer support and was very pleased. I will buy from Cowin in the future

Edit: 10-11-18

I am still using these headphones and continue to be blown away by their deceptively good quality. I mean these suckers refuse to die. I’ve added a few photos this time to show how much abuse they’ve taken over the past few years. The leather is gnarled over the headpiece. There are scratches everywhere. I’ve even dropped this pair off my roof by accident. They didn’t care. They laughed and kept playing the ‘Man of Steel’ film score. Not even joking - that really happened. The battery life remains miraculous. Still getting 30+ hours of play time on full volume. That is an absolute feat considering the common life of Li-Ion batteries. The buttons still work. The Noise Cancelling still works. And despite their twisted appearance, they remain unconventionally comfortable. In my previous post I mentioned that they had started to squeak around the hinges. Yeah that just stopped. I am seriously astounded by these headphones and wonder if I’ll ever even need to upgrade to the E8’s. In any case - Cowin has still got my vote when it comes down to a reasonably priced headphone of extraordinary longevity.

author: logan
title: updated review.
content:
These are nice headphones for everything but volume control. Firstly, the volume up button in below the volume down button which is above. Secondly, the volume changes by jumps not a percent scale. It's 10,20,30,40... compared to 1,2,3,4....

update!!!!!! 7/16/18
less than a year of ownership and these have fallen apart. i work in an office. they never leave my desk and are already broken at the joints.

update 2 6/11/19
after speaking with customer rep and a second pair of headphones sent to me. the audio jack no longer works...

these have a but a one year life cycle. and again these have no scratches on them and never leave my office. one year ans one thing or another breaks....

author: Will S.
title: Excellent quality for the price
content: I bought these to use while I was doing yard work.  I had always used wired pairs because my old iPod didn't have blue tooth and I thought the wireless ones would be unreliable.  Well, my iPod finally died after a decade and I had to buy a new one so I gave the wireless headphones a try.  I was very much impressed.  The sound quality was decent, the noise cancelling worked really well and I wasn't ripping a cord out with the weed eater every five minutes.  It was also nice that I could jump off of my mower to pick up sticks leaving my iPod on the mower.  I easily went up to 15 feet away with no problem. It wasn't until I started walking back to my garage and lost connection that I realize I left my iPod on my mower 30 feet away.

author: Michael
title: Hope I can get these replaced or returned. (GREAT UPDATE!!!)
content:
Ok, so I bought these for my Dad and he used them for watching TV when my Mom was sleeping in the same room.
 He absolutely loved them!  Then the bluetooth glitched the day after the return period.  I was so irritated.  I put a review on here while irritated and then contacted the manufacturer...not really expecting them to take care of me.  WELL, they replied promptly and sent out a new pair asap.  Then they called to make sure that I was doing ok.  The lady that called was very kind and apologetic I am SUPER happy that I bought from this company!  They've stood behind their product and they seem to really care about their customers.  I'm very impressed!  I wish there were a 6 star rating that I could give them for exceeding my expectations completely.

Original Post - I was SOOO bummed!
(Bluetooth quit working!  Got them for my dad.  He only used them a few times.  Now they are useless...!)

author: Christy and Tim
title: Exactly what I need for a decent price
content:
I have been using these headphones for a couple of weeks now, and they have been great, especially for the price.  I bought them to use at work to better concentrate when people around me are "collaborating".  I have also used them in my home office and they are fantastic.  Here is a breakdown of the pros and cons:

Noise Cancelling: Both a Pro and a Con:
- Con: These are not really "noise cancelling".  It would be more accurate to call them "Ambient background noise reducing".  When I turn on the noise cancelling feature, you can definitely tell a difference, but you can still hear people talking and some other background noises.  Just know that these will NOT cut out ALL noise (but neither did the big name brand $300 "B" headphones I tried).  Have realistic expectations when you buy these.
- Pro: They DO reduce much of the ambient background noise that you often do not even realize is there. When you turn on the Noise Cancelling function, you can tell a difference, especially when I am at work and it almost completely eliminates the sound of the building air circulation system and my desk fan, etc.  It is a subtle change, but it has a surprisingly big impact on my ability to focus on my work.  If you are expecting TOTAL silence, you will be disappointed.  If you are expecting these to help you focus by reducing some background noise, these are great.  I have also found that it is a good thing that I can still hear co-workers talking because I can hear if somebody is trying to get my attention.  These seem to block out just enough to make a difference and help me focus, but I can still hear enough so that I am not totally removed from the environment.  A good balance for what I need.

Pros:
- Great price!  These were about 1/6th the cost of the big name brand "B" headphones my coworker has.  I have tried them side by side, and while I am no pro, I could not tell a difference.
- Comfort; padded in all the right areas, they are comfortable on the top of my head as well as around my ears. Easy to wear for an hour or two, although they do get a little warm on my ears (just built up body heat since your ears are fully enclosed, there does not seem to be any head coming from the speakers at all).
- Functional; the sound quality is decent; just as good as the $300 name brand "B" headphones I compared them to, although I generally like the sound quality of earbuds better, these seem to provide the same sound quality as any other full enclosure headphones I have tried.
- Easy to connect via Bluetooth to my phone.
- I use both the noise cancelling and Bluetooth settings about equally.  Sometimes I need to cut out ambient noise and focus, other times I want to listen to music, and both work well
- Battery life; so far I have only charged it once (proactively).  The battery life seems to be fantastic!

Cons:
- they do not feel heavy duty.  I hesitate to list this as a con because you want headphones to be light so they remain comfortable while wearing them, and these are light.  My concern is whether or not they will break.  NOTHING has broken so far, but I would not throw these in a backpack without a case.  If you plan on transporting these from one location to another, I would recommend purchasing a hard-shell carrying case just to be safe
- Strange button design: for some reason they put the 'Volume Up' and 'Next Track' buttons BELOW the 'Volume Down' and 'Previous Track' button.  So to turn the volume up, you have to press the 'down' button, and to turn it down, you have to press the 'up' button.  It is a minor thing and you get used to it fast enough, it is just an odd design that I think they could easily improve.

At the end of the day these have been great headphones at a fraction (1/6th) the price of their major name brand competitor.  Definitely recommended if you want something functional and are on a budget.

author: Collin Lee
title: Superb customer care
content:
I purchased these headphones hoping to use it during my commute and at home while I spend time playing some PC game with friends.

PROS: sound quality is great. I believe it is very comparable with the more expensive and popular brands out there. When I connect the device to my phone, the music sounds superb.

CONS: It's quite sensitive to the bluetooth connection. My desktop is underneath my desk and noises get very static when I'm sitting on my chair, however, works very well when I was sitting underneath my desk for testing purposes.

UPDATE 7/28/2017
COWIN reached out after sending another set of headphones after I returned it, asking if I was still facing the issues, and to provide them with another review. Honestly, my issue was not completely resolved again. I'm still having connection issues (mentioned above) when my desktop is underneath the table. However, I am very touched by the customer service. As mentioned, the product quality is superb when the bluetooth is working fine  without any obstacles in between your connection. The level of customer service will be very memorable.

author: joe01880
title: Excellent sounding at any price point
content:
I own Bose wired headphones and my Cowin E7's hang with them note for note. Great bass response and nice highs. The noise cancellation seems really good for what they cost plus no wires. I'm jamming to DIO while my wife is running the vacuum, can't hear it run. No complaints from. I was fixing to spend $300 more than what these coast on Bose. Thought I'd try these first, can always return them but I'm see no reason to and saved the $300 by keeping them.
I fully recommend Cowin E7 noise cancelling headphones, I'm an audiophile folks, if I like I'm in you'll most likely love them, rocking to Pink Floyd as I your this on my cellphone. Buy them, for all the money you'll save you will be glad you did!!

author: carlos
title: Best headphones under $150, but has its compromises
content:
I reviewed the Cowing E7 and three other budget noise cancelling headphones: Tribit XFree Tune, MPOW H5 and the TaoTronics. The Cowing E7 is by far the best.

Pros
- Great audio quality. Basses were punchy and did not distort even on low frequencies, in the 15 - 20 Hz range. Trebles were crispy and clear all the way to 15KHz.
- Good noise active noise cancellation. It was able to mute most of the noise from my fridge
- Beautiful packaging
- Easy bluetooth pairing
- Great value for the money

Cons
- Uncomfortable. The ear pads are small and round. They go over your ear, not around it, and apply too much pressure. After 30 minutes of use, it started hurting. This was the only reason why I did not keep these. If you have small ears, you may like them though.
- Design feels a bit cheap. There is too much shining plastic and fingerprints stick everywhere
- Does not fold. It takes a lot of space.
- Does not work once battery dies
- Physical controls are limited. You have volume control and a single toggle for BT and ANC. There are no track controls, like pause or next. There are also not any controls to invoke the assistant from your phone.
- No case. It comes with a bag though.

Alternatives
The Cowin E7 costs at least $10 more than all the other headphones I tested. This difference is worth it though. The TaoTronics, Tribit and MPOW all sound terrible in comparison and none of them holds a candle to the noise cancellation of the Cowin.

These are the best headphones I tested under $150 dollars. If you are willing to spend more than that though, consider the Sennheiser HD 4.50 (around $150) or the superb Bose Quiet Comfort 35. Both have better sound, noise cancellation and are more comfortable.

Verdict
Buy the Cowin E7 if it is comfortable for you and your budget is under $150.

author: nowman
title: Subpar Active Noise Cancelling
content:
I bought this product *mainly* for the "active" noise cancelling feature. Unfortunately, the product doesn't measure up in this category. If you're looking for decent bluetooth headphones with moderate *passive* noise cancelling, this might be a good purchase for you.  Not for me.
3M Peltor X5A earmuffs (www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00CPCHBCQ) that I bought 5 years ago - that use only PASSIVE noise cancellation technology - work much better to block noise than this Cowin product.
To make sure that some active noise cancelling technology actually does measure up, I went to Best Buy and tried several headphones with this feature... All the ones I tried (yes, costing at least 3 times more) outperformed the Cowin in this category. Admittedly, some of the products at Best Buy - e.g., Skull Candy - just barely outperformed the Cowin headphones. In fact, only one set of active noise candelling headphones I tried out at Best Buy clearly outperformed the passive noise cancelling of my 3M ear muffs - the Sony model WH1000XM3. But not quite sure yet if it's worth $350 - for my modest need of removing noisy neighbor sounds from my awareness during an otherwise meditative morning time.

author: D. G.
title: A1 customer service
content:
Update :
After being disapppointed with the perfomance of the first set contacted the seller and was impressed with great customer service. I just received my new pair and while still not what i was hoping for they sound much much better. Thank you people at Cowin for making the purchase worthwhile.

I was impressed with the look and feel of them. I only needed the basic function of them so the noise cancellation and Bluetooth were just bonuses.
With that said I was expecting great sound and was greatly disappointed. The bass response was non existent and which for me greatly affected the quality. I am contemplating returning them.

author: J. Duncan
title: Not for the large headed, still
content:
EDIT:  I'm leaving my original review at the bottom.  But, I absolutely HAVE to mention the customer service experience I have had with COWIN.  Even after I had already returned the first set i bought, they were willing to ship me a completely new pair FOR FREE to allow me a chance to give them another, more lengthy test.  Which I absolutely have done, so i can say plenty more about them.  Fit wise, they are still not ideal for someone with my head size and ear size.  Which are definitely far above average.  But, after spending lots of time fiddling around with them, i found a way that they were at least comfortable enough to wear while doing chores around the house and other like tasks.  The max time I could stand was about 45 minutes, so definitely not good for marathon gaming sessions or Netflix binge watching.  The other major complaint I have about these is the noise cancellation.  Its mostly passive from the foam pad seal, which is actually VERY EXCELLENT.  However, when I turned on the active NC, it... didn't really do anything but muffle the music quite a bit while only SLIGHTLY reducing ambient noise more than just the seal does.  This is definitely an area of "you get what you pay for" so if more isolation is what you're looking for, you're gonna have to spend way more than $80.  Sound reproduction is absolutely top notch though.  Very clear and crisp while I was listening to house and electronica EDM.  The low end and bass is NOT punchy at all though.  Not something I care much about, but if that's something you want, you're also gonna have to look elsewhere.  Despite all its shortcomings though, I HIGHLY recommend this set of headphones.

I'm going to preface this review with some simple facts.  I have a VERY BIG head (size 8 hats are usually uncomfortably snug, depending on the manufacture) and also abnormally sensitive ears.  I found the clamping force to be too snug for my taste and the ear cups pinched and flattened my ears to the point of discomfort in about 5 minutes.  However, if you are someone that doesn't suffer from such annoyances, you'll most likely love these.  The sound quality was fantastic for my use case (music and PC games).  I cant say anything about either the battery life or the noise cancellation as I dint own them long enough to test either.

author: Colorado-MAC
title: Price is great, listening and noise canceling quality is great. Call quality (microphone) is not. UPDATED: 3 August 2017
content:
Considering the reviews, I expected (and wanted) to love these, especially for the price. I work in an open office setting, and need the ability to make clear, static free calls. The volume isn't loud enough, the sound quality is barely better than in-ear buds, and despite the noise canceling feature, callers on the other end seem to hear everything. Disappointing.

Update 3 August 2017:
First, Cowin's customer service is outstanding. They contacted me soon after my initial review, expressed their apologies, and sent me a new pair to review. For that alone, they get four stars.

Regarding the new headphones with what appears to be upgraded firmware, the sound quality is better, the volume is louder without being obnoxious, and the noise canceling is very good. The only reason I can't give it five stars is because the microphone quality is not good. The other person on the call said it sounds like I'm in a tunnel with a lot of static.

The E-7 is a great product for listening and noise canceling, but I can't recommend it for phone calls.

Again, their customer service is top notch.

author: PichiXtreme
title: Great sound and great connection.
content:
EDIT (5/12): After my negative review, Cowin customer service reached out to me. They apologized for the inconvenience and offered to send me another pair free of charge. Please keep in mind they did NOT ask for a positive review in return, this is coming out of my own volition. I received the new pair and I must say they are phenomenal!!! The sound is loud, crisp and clear. The connection is good and the noise cancelling feature does it's job. I have to assume the first pair I received was defective because there is no comparison. I am a happy customer.
1. Appearance  4
2. Sound quality  5
3. Noise canceling function 5
4. Battery life  5
5. Comfort  5

Original review : I received these on 4/25.... used them for 30 minutes and packed them up for their return. The Bluetooth connection was terrible. It was so spotty and it would "skip" every time I took a step. I them tried the aux cord and it was bad as well. I had someone else try them on and they asked me to put the volume up..... I told them it was at its highest and they could barely hear the music. I was excited after reading the reviews but these are not even worth the 62 dollars.

author: Fabulous Finn
title: Very Nice, Comfortable
content: I needed headphones to block out the woman at work who refuses to cure, control, or muffle her loud and nearly continuous full-volume throat and nose clearing and hacking. Unable to call her out on her behavior or general health issues, or relocate my desk, I opted to cancel her out without paying a huge sum of money. These headphones are lightweight and comfortable, the Bluetooth connection is easy, the listening quality is very good, and the price is very good. I still have to play background music or white noise (streams, rain, etc.) to block her out, but at least now I can.

author: Y. Velazco
title: Not as what others reviewed
content:
I pulled the triggersd on this and all I can say was WOW, one of the worst headphones I have owned.  I will admit, I was so excited all day to receive this based on reviews I read and the feedback from happy customers.  Unfortunately, mine was the opposite.
1. Easy pair was amazing
2. Cracking sound at the beginning of each music.  No it's not the music as I have used other headphones and earphones and BT speakers and the output was all fine.
3. Noise cancellation did not work.  Full 100% battery and toggling the switch on/off/on and powering off the entire unit didn't help at all.  I even turned down my TV to 10 bars out of 50 and I can still hear it over the music I was playing on the headphones.

Nonetheless, this guy is going right back to Amazon.

author: Matt
title: Almost Perfect - Excellent For The Price!
content:
I grew tired of spending hundreds of dollars every year on new headphones, so, decided to give a less expensive set a try, to see if they could stack up to the more expensive, name brand units. I was pleasantly surprised to find that these headsets are nearly as good as the big boys. Sounds quality is lacking just a tad - but, I'm a bit of an audiophile, so I am extra critical when it comes to sound quality. The high-end sounds decent, while the low end struggles just a tad - but I imagine for most folks, the sound quality will be excellent.

I do a lot of flying, so the noise cancellation is important to me. The headphones perform very well in noise cancellation mode, with minimal degradation of sound while in use (again, you will lose a little low-end when using noise cancellation). I also love the fact that you can use these corded, or cordless. The entertainment system on planes requires a headphone input - so, I can quickly plug it into these headsets and watch their entertainment. But, if I'm just using with my phone, the Bluetooth works wonderfully as well.

The battery life is by far, the best I've ever seen with over the air headphones. They last forever - easily 20 hours of use before needing a charge.

My only complaint is the volume up/down and track forward/back buttons are complicated, and not placed in an ideal spot. The buttons are on the outside, in a triangle setup, with combined volume up/down and track forward/back buttons. I hate the combo buttons. Plus, the up/down buttons are "reversed" from what you would expect, logically. Turning the volume up requires you to push the bottom button, etc. But, this is not enough to take away from a 5-star rating. It's just a small annoyance that I quickly adapted to.

All-in-all, if you are not a super-picky audiophile, these headsets should work great for you!

author: Aaron Balentine
title: Great headphone, bad Bluetooth
content:
First off, customer service deserves 5 ⭐ just for the effort they took to try and make everything good with me.
The SE7 headphones are a great set of headphones. The sound is very clear and has a great depth of tones with bass. The Bluetooth is very quick and easy to use, it pairs very quickly when turned on. I was able to get over 40ft away from my phone and still have good signal. I love the headphone design and carrying case. I just throw these in my luggage when traveling and don't worry about them being damaged.  The noise cancelling really works well. I have a train that comes by frequently and I would turn on the nose cancelling to block the train horn. I never used the 3.5 jack to plug into my phone since my phone does not have a headphone jack connection.

However the microphone when using Bluetooth for a phone call is mediocre at best. It sounds like you're talking on speaker phone from the other side of the room. People kept asking me to repeat my sentences because they could not hear me. The buttons are very small and close together, made it hard for me to manipulate the controls without taking the headphones off. But I'm 6'4" with XL hands.
If you're traveling or just listening to music these headphones are great. But if you plan on using them to talk on your phone, I cannot recommend them. I primarily use my headphones when walking and working out while being able to take phone calls.

author: AJ
title: Great sound. Bass is very good.
content:
I bought the red ones. I really like the look and the color of the headphones. They look like quality headphones. They are lightweight which I like. They have function buttons on the side which is nice...took me a little getting used to but it's convenient.

I really like the sound quality. I thought the bass was actually pretty good, better than more expensive brands I've tried. The battery life is also very good. Right now I use these solely for listening to music from my phone so I haven't used them for more than 3 hours in one use so far and the battery life was still in the upper 80% range. I always charge them back up to 100%. They charge pretty fast. They're really easy to pair and once I turn them on they automatically pair to my phone.

Overall I would recommend these headphones. I would also recommend buying from Cowin because they have amazing customer service!

author: Andrew Shaddock
title: Attractive and well constructed headphones
content:
Out of the box these are very attractive headphones.  After charging the battery, I was quickly able to make a Bluetooth connection to my Android phone.  The sound quality was excellent.  I was able to adjust the phones to the size of my (large) head.  I then wired a connection between the phones to my home stereo, and the sound quality was good for a variety of music.

My only issue so far has been the learning curve viz a viz the controls.  I have found it hard to locate the switch, the cable socket and other controls since I am looking for black on black, and the on-off, Bluetooth switch is tiny.  I am hoping that with use I will become more adept at using the controls.  I have used Bose Quiet Comfort phones in the past, which have fallen apart after many years, and feel that they had somewhat stronger noise cancellation, but at a much higher price.  I am looking forward to using the Cowins on an airplane, the ultimate test.

Overall I am very happy with the headphones and regard them as great value for money

author: MatthewZillah
title: Not great - but not too horrible - ok .. honestly kind of just MEH...
content:
- Do not buy them if you're expecting to be serious about active noise cancelling
- Do not by them unless you are okay with ANOTHER thing to recharge in order to be usable (NO passive audio)

I am spoiled by BOSE QuietComfort 25 .. So I'm using that as my 5 baseline benchmark out of 5:

SUMMARY
- Sound quality [4]
- Noise cancelling [1] (the earcups are pretty good just by themselves)
- Cost to value [3]
- Head wearing comfort [4]
- Features / operation [2]

PROS
- Super nice packaging
- Slick design
- Very comforatble
- Good weight, the earcups keep a decent amount of ambient noise out
- Comes with rechargable battery preinstalled
- Pairing is straightforward and easy
- Sound quality is great
- And then suddenly  ...

CONS
- With active noise cancelling activated just completely removes any hope for bass response that you had
- It is as if it is cancelling the ambient sound noise bleed through out of the earcup itself!
- With active noise cancelling active, you can hear a constant HISS that LOUDER than NOT having it on [Old Cassette tape hiss]
- With active noise cancelling on, if you wiggle the side (which you will do because of all the controls) it does a very strange thing and cuts out and jumbles the audio signal for a moment
- To use them you have to have them CONSTANTLY in the ON position, thus zapping your brain with bluetooth radiation [which makes me want to take them off]
- They include a 1/8" adapter, however you can't use them as standard pass-through headphones [OFF MEANS OFF!]
- To turn UP the volume, the button is on the BOTTOM, and turning DOWN is on the TOP - very counter intuitive control
- The chrome gets "fingerprinty" SUPER fast and looks gnarly (maybe I just have gnarly oily hands?)
- The included cable is MAYBE only 2 1/2 feet?

author: Jessica Wilson
title: Save your money...
content:
Got these on July 16, 2017 and today is October 11th 2017, and they quit working. They are fully charged, and are kept in the protective case always, there was no damage due to being poorly cared for or dropped. Do not buy these! The noise cancelling doesn't work either, save up your money and buy Bose.
*EDIT TO ADD UPDATE* The company I bought these from read my review and sent me a new headphone at no extra cost to me. They worked fine until last week, in the middle of my work day when the sound just stopped. It showed that my audio book was still playing, and it displayed correctly when I pushed the button on the right earpiece to pause, but there was no sound...nothing. So this pair worked for an even shorter time than the first pair. Now I have 2 sets of headphones that don't work, and I'm even more bummed. I can honestly say the quality in comparison with the cost is just not worth it...I will never buy this brand again, I've learned my lesson. I really wanted to be able to change my review for the better, sadly I think my opinion has gotten worse. This company "Cowin" needs to get some quality control people who actually know what they're doing.

author: CLA
title: Very good noise cancellation
content:
I've used it in an international flight and I loved it! The noise cancelling feature worked very well.

In a domestic flight something weird was going on and I noticed some interference from my son's headphone on mine and I could hear parts of his movie on my own headphone as noise. The issue was minimized when the volume on his headphone was lowered.

Thanks!

author: Sarah
title: Defective :(  UPDATED: Cowin Customer Service Went Above and Beyond
content:
I bought these to use on a flight since I couldn't find my Bose QC 25s.  I wish I had tested them prior to the flight.  Any time the headset is lightly bumped, the sound cuts out.  I will say that I don't think this is an intended feature of the product.  I'm pretty sure that the pair I received is defective.  I am sending them back, but I still had to listen to cutting out of sound and crying children because this headset is defective.  I'm going to return them and buy something else.

UPDATE 10/12/2017:
Cowin customer service sent me a new unit (I had already returned the old pair through Amazon).  The new pair does not suffer from the same problem as the old one.  I have a very serious ear infection and am unable to hear out of my right ear right now, so I can't fairly review this product right now, but I wanted to update my review quickly to indicate that Cowin customer service went above and beyond.  I can tell that the sound isn't cutting out when the headphones are touched.  I will add a more in depth review once my hearing has returned.

author: Zack
title: Issue Resolved ***
content:
Update 01/14/2019***

I received a reply from the manufacturer and they provided a replacement. As previously stated, this was a great headphone while it worked, so I am hoping for a better experience this time around.

*******

I have had this headset for a few months now, it has great sound and is really comfortable. My problem is that the charging side earpiece detached for no reason from the headpiece. There was no fall or any type of shock to cause this issue, so I can only assume this is due to substandard materials and poor design. If you are looking for something to hold you over a couple months then this is fine. However, if you want something good that will last then look elsewhere.

author: cwg_at_opc
title: so far i like it for what it is
content:
so far i like it for what it is, a relatively inexpensive noise cancelling headset with bluetooth connectivity.

likes: comfort, weight, audio quality, customer service
dislikes: NC circuit works only on a relatively narrow band of sound, first pair died after a week

comments: as noted, the first pair died after about a week of use, they started to make a weird hum/whine noise and then it wouldn't charge.
customer service was very good, getting me a new replacement headset  fairly quickly(and no charge)

i bought these with the intent to reduce the noise exposure in my office which is next to a small data center with a shared, open ceiling. the overall noise is quite loud with four data servers, six linux boxes(rendering and LTO service) and two mac pros(to serve macs in the main office)
occassionally i would get massive headaches due to the noise levels and ear plugs made my head fill up.  not wanting to go all in on an isolating headset, i thought i'd try to see if the noise reduction would help. the difference is interesting to say the least - while i can still hear most of the fans and computers, i don't get headaches anymore and when you switch the NC circuit off, you notice the 'whooshing' noise is what's missing.  i have not tried these on an airplane flight, but i'd bet they would be very good at killing that dull, loud whooshing that is so annoying.  having never tried any of the more expensive brands, i don't anything to compare these to, but i like these.  what surprised me the most is how good music sounds with NC on, good bass(not boomy or thumping) clear mids and highs, not shrill or brittle. very smooth and not fatiguing to listen to.

author: Laura J
title: Good inexpensive option
content:
1st off- these headphones are overall a good purchase especially when compared to higher end ones.
Pros-
When music is playing , they do block out sound fairly effectively
priced fairly
connects to your phone super easily
ease of use and reasonable charge time
sound quality is good for the price

Cons-
They don't seem to be a one size is good for all set of headphone, they fit me fine but they only fit ok on my husband and we try to share headphones (so if you have a larger head, you may not like them)
They aren't a high quality build, they however do not feel super cheap
Sound quality is good for price but it isn't high end sound, so if you want really good sound, you will want to spend more money.

Takeaway- overall for the price and my needs these are excellent. I need them to play music and audio books and to block out sound and do it effectively. I need sub- $100 headphone and these are it. :)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Some What Effective To reduce Some airplane Noise
content:
Nicely Built. But Squeezes My Head & Ears Hard Therefore You Can Not Wear It On Long Flights.  Battery Life Is Good. Good If You Want To Connect To Air Plane Monitor. You Can Hear Movies Good , But Noise Reduction Is Not Perfect.
Update: I Changed My Product Review From 3 Star to One Star Since After leaving Above Comments .A Girl From Cowin With Name Of Jane Called Me Direct On My Personal Phone & Ask Me Why I Left A Negative comment About Their Product .  I Cut her Phone Call Off & Advise Her If She Has Any Questions Email It Thru Amazon Rather Than Harassing Me Thru My Person Phone.
 BE AWARE ABOUT DISCLOSING YOUR DETAILS ON THE PACKAGES & BE AWARE OF THIS COMPANY.

author: M. Lennartz
title: All day comfort
content:
Update: Great headphones still average battery life is 26 hrs, when I remember to turn them off they can last 30 hrs. Initially a 5 star review -1 star for not being able to just plug them into a source and listen- they need to be charged which can be an inconvenience but honestly for the sound quality I'm fine with it. All day comfort no issues great product!

One day of use so far so longevity, I will make a mental note and come back on hopefully in 6 months but honestly my memory is lacking sometimes so it may be a year.

Initial impressions...... Wait these are less then $60. Wow what a bargain box shows up inside that Amazon cardboard box perfect condition. Headphone packaging was made for higher end( these when a new product I guess) product then this price point so bonus to us the consumer. Opening the box you see the carrying bag almost seems of the same material as the headphone pads more on them later. Pull the bag aside anf the Headphones lay facing at you. Mine are black and beautiful, presentation is top notch right up there with the Sennheiser phones these are replacing at almost 4x this price point. Nice work Cowin Group. These headphones are so adjustable they fit my big ole 7 7/8 like a velvet glove. Comfortable? Oh my goodness yes wore them for 10.5 hrs today at work hardly noticed them  bad part is I almost forgot I had them on and plugged in haha that woukd've be an ooppsssie. :). Came with a full charge nice to see how long they will last. Anyways I listen to good ole blues, jazz (Miles Davis sounds so so fantastic), metal, r& b, top 40 and so far not one sound out of tune or artificial sounding. I love them.
I love the thank you note, I love the VIP card.

I love these Cowins not sure how they created this super lush material that sits over my ears but I"m glad they did. Comfort 5 stars. I hope too remember and come back in the future which will be present then and update. If you hear nothing i must love them more. 😀

author: Dysnomia
title: Stop--look elsewhere for headphones
content:
I researched all the review sites, I read all the Amazon reviews. I've tried a few different models. I'm looking specifically for diverse headphones that don't sacrifice clarity for bass. I thought I could expect a good result from these, as Cowin seems to have a good rapport. First, I'll give the good.
PROS: comfortable, wide ear cups. They sat quite naturally over my ears. The low bass notes punch through pretty well. They look stylish.
CONS: Cheap, crappy build. The headband is kid toy-level plastic painted silver. Feels like it won't take much. The interface is annoying; slide the on button slightly too much and you might turn to NTC or OFF. For the sound quality, the treble is horrible, the mids are under average. The only good sound quality is the low bass tones, which are stronger than any other similarly-priced models I tried. But the overall sound quality is muddy, muffled and pushed behind the blanketing low tones. These are only good for bass-drenched music, and cannot be used across genres. Finally, if you're at all serious about the ANC, you need to upgrade to a higher price level. I can tell you after trying headphones in this price range, the ANC technology just isn't there. It cuts out low tones, but you can hear the noise just the same. It also ruins your sound quality.
CONLUSION: With the cheap build and underperforming sound, I almost immediately knew I would be returning these. If you just want a pair of headphones with good low bass, these may work for you. If you're a discerning listener, look elsewhere.

author: BBS818
title: Take two.
content:
Generally my reviews are short and occasionally one word (Usually Movies/Shows). If you prefer something succinct scroll to the bottom.

I originally purchased these headphones in 2017. I was less than impressed, a one star review. I went out on bought a refurbished JBL Elite 700 headphones $100 ( new was over $300 at the time). No way I'm spending over $100 for headphones, and even that's pushing it. They sounded great, and the noise canceling superb.

Now I'm trying the Cowins again. I pair it with my phone LG Android. The sound wasn't good. The JBLs sound great but keep in mind I had to adjust the built in EQ in addition to purchasing a sound booster/EQ app. Without the sound booster the volume with the JBLs was too low.

I spent a lot of time fine tuning the JBL sound profiles for various genres of music and really, there's too many.  I love tweaking the heck out of things like OSes, certain electronics, but headphones? No! I should be able to turn them on/or plug-in and enjoy.

Of course I'm disappointed, but this time I also paired it with my iPad Pro 10.5. I started watching The Matrix and was blown away. The JBLs have a bit better bass, but with the JBLs I kept waiting for parts of the movie in which my thought was, hey this is going to sound really awesome.

The Cowins audio is exceptional throughout the entire movie. After spending 30 minutes messing with JBLs EQ, I just couldn't get them to sound like the Cowins. I've watched the Matrix many times over so I wasn't planning on watching the entire movie. Couldn't help it with the Cowins. JBLs? stopped it in short order.

A comparison for games was necessary as well. Compared to the Cowins, JBL failed miserably .  No amount of tweaking the built in EQ helped.

*I still need to review the NFC, but I wanted to redo my review as it was negative the first time. I will also take this time to apologize to the manufacture for not trying the headphones on other devices and rating the product so low.*

A personal note. The JBLs are heavy and a bit tight, you can't listen to them for a long time without your head hurting. I also had surgery on my neck. I can't wear the JBLs because of the weight.  The Cowins are light enough to watch an entire movie.

I just noticed there's an updated Cowin headphones. One pair for me and one for my wife. Saving up enough to see<=== lol how they sound. Goes hand in hand with the succinct version of my review.

For you shot review junkies.
Cowins sound as awesome as an OLED display looks compared to my LCD monitors.

Superb Customer Service. THANK YOU!

author: FlintStone1
title: Banging base!
content:
Awesome! Awesome! Awesome! Purchased this for A flight to Africa as there's always a hollering baby on board. Lol. This solved my problem, didn't hear a thing! Returned first pair due to a distortion noise made by headphones. Second pair did the same thing but I'd left for Africa. After a couple days of use the distortion ceased and they've worked wonderfully since. I'd recommend these instead of beats! I've owned 2 pair of beats and this is a far better and more economical set of premium headphones! The base is awesome. I like my music loud and these babies deliver! And the awesome color choices makes it a better purchase!
The battery life is outstanding! It almost lasts forever! The crisp clear sound is addicting. I absolutely love these headphones. Best price for this high quality. Great for gifts. 😍

author: Felix
title: Decent headsets, excellent service.
content:
Ordered these after some research and price/feature comparisons.  First though, I should mention that I have never really owned over the head headsets with pads this large that can completely cover the ears.  However I have tested various similar in the stores.  Long and short - there is nothing better than the high end Bose for noise cancelling, but at $350 simply not an option for me.  The noise cancelling on these for me don't really do it, but I never understood the need once you have the volume up!  Compared the Beats and other headsets, these are actually pretty decent.  In addition, they come with audio connectors, so if the battery dies on you and you have an audio output on your system (phone, tablet, laptop) you can plug them right in and keep on going.

Service:  I had an issue while using these at the gym where I changed equalizer settings and had crackling sounds and strange control behaviors.  I mentioned to the vendor and they did not hesitate to send me another pair to replace the first purchase.  Absolutely floored me.  So while the first pair "might" have a problem with the bluetooth, the second did not demonstrate the same issue.  Excellent service and support!

Good base, good volume, long battery life, and the audio connector is a great backup. If you want the best then you will pay for the best. Bottom line, these are perfectly decent for the price.

author: MG3
title: Small issue with NC function, but otherwise great headphones!
content:
I have been looking for a pair of Bluetooth NC headphones for a while. I finally landed on these after some research.

1. Appearance

They are sleek black and chrome plastic. Very durable and aesthetically pleasing in my opinion. Subdued classic look. The pads and headband have a leather-type material covering them for comfort and added appearance. They arrived exactly as pictured.

2. Sound Quality

Extremely crisp, high quality on-ear headphones. Part of the reason for my 4 star rating instead of 5, is that they do not get as loud as other headphones I've had. The built in volume control on the side doesn't allow these headphones to get very loud.

3. Noise cancelling function

The biggest part of my 4 star review instead of 5 is the noise cancelling function. It does work when activated, but a strange problem occurs with my headset that may or may not be present in all of them. If I have the NC function on, and the headphones shake while on my head at all, such as turning my head quickly enough, there is a stutter in sound and quality where it drops for a moment. This problem is easily reproduceable. While not moving or rattling the headphones in any way, the NC function works great.

4. Battery Life

I use an iPhone 6s Plus, and when using these headphones there is a battery bar displayed at the top of my screen. So far, after being used for a few hours, I haven't even began to scratch the surface of the battery life on these headphones, even with NC activated. Awesome battery life indeed.

5. Comfort

Everyone has a preference for headphone type, and I prefer on-ear cups. These are great. The material in the pads is soft and form fitting, and you can tighten the headband enough that they won't fall off your head when moving around with them on. They can also lay behind your head over your neck, and are just as comfortable.

Overall the problem with the NC was a little disappointing for me personally, but over all well worth the price for the battery life, style, and comfort. I would still reccomend these headphones to just about anyone.

author: Whovian Bookworm
title: You get what you pay for.
content:
As many others have reviewed these broke out of the blue. There was no dropping or damage to them but because of the ear pieces having the ability to swivel so they can be stored flat, it WILL wear out. I haven't even had these a year and I'm very careful with them. I'm very disappointed and will be looking elsewhere for a replacement. I also can't say I found them very noise cancelling but they did provide some masking of outside sound.

UPDATE: Cowin did reach out to me regarding my review. I appreciate the refund I was given and so I do give them kudos for good customer service to me and standing behind their product but still wish the product would've lasted as they were very comfortable headphones.

author: P. graham
title: blue tooth isues  and stopped working
content:
i had gotten these for a trip i was taking . at first i loved them the noise canceling, like in so many other reviews is on the low end. they really takes away the ambient noise but you can still here people talking. the sound quality for me was good . After about six hours of use the blue tooth had stopped working.the noise canceling continued to work  i first thought that they needed to be charges so i did that (i was no where near the thirty hours that they claimed ) but thinking i left the switch on just maybe!. after charging no help with the blue tooth . i then left the on to completely discharge and recharge still no help. and to add insult to injury i ended up carrying them all over the place like empty weight.
also the pair i got looks like it might have been used. Not new like they claimed maybe repackaged
the pros
they are comfortable
they sounded good while they were working
cons
blue tooth failed after six hours
noise canceling isn't the best
looked like maybe they were refurbished or used and sold as new?

author: OG Sasquatch
title: great headphones, nice price, features nearing 300 dollar phones. I'll take it!!
content: For the price, I love these headphones. I have them paired with all types of things and get great sound, or I can choose to block noise, and they don't make you feel pressure in your ears like most cheap ones do, but I don't like noise cancel when listening to music, it takes away from it, so I let them be open with music and use the noise cancelling feature when trying to find peace or using as a comm device. At first the controls seemed strange, but after just a few uses, all the buttons seem to be well placed. No way I'm spending over 300 dollars for a set that can just barely edge out these!. I love em so far I've had no problems whatsoever and they sound great and are comfortable to wear. They don't have that high dollar ear muff material, so if left one for a length of time, they can make you ears hot, but other that that I feel as though I have a set of Bose or Sony's on for MUCH less money. A great starter set too, to see if maybe you do want to spend more, I bet you will still keep and use these!!!!! hehe

author: Mabe
title: Buy cheap headphones and get what you pay for
content:
The good:
+ Cheap (like the budge).
+ Sound quality is okay. Not bad. Fine. Alright. Acceptable.
+ Durable, in that Fischer-Price way.
+ Battery life is pretty good.

- Noise cancelling is more like noise reduction. It will cut out lower frequencies a bit, but anyone who has used nicer noise cancelling headphones will turn on the feature and be disappointed.
- They're not that comfortable. The ear cut padding is quite thick, but doesn't really apply even pressure around the ears. The padding is also round instead of oval? The top band is well padded, but the big, thick plastic headband still puts a lot of pressure on the top of my head. I think that a lot of the discomfort I have from wearing these for more than a few hours at a time is down to...
- The E7 is heavy. There's no forgetting you have these strapped to your head. And the cans themselves are massive. I suspect that Cowin chunked the biggest batteries they could into these so they advertise long battery life without regard to weight.
- The mic is inadequate. No one can hear me when I'm speaking at normal phone talking volume, so if I get a call while wearing them I have to un-pair them from my phone. Bleh.
- The E7 alerts you when the battery is getting low by chirping. Fine. But it does this about 30~ minutes before you run out of juice and then KEEPS DOING IT for the rest of the time. So subtract 30 minutes from the battery time  because listening to the low battery warning is obnoxious as hell.

author: Michael Sinclair
title: I've been searching for a long time...
content:
Let me begin by saying that my hearing isn't the best - I'm 68 and I tend to hear sounds as slightly muffled. I just received these Cowin E7 headphones today so these are very early impressions!

The headphones paired up with my PC immediately and without any difficulty - much easier than my old headphones. It took me a little while to locate and function test the controls -  but once I found everything 8t was easy to operate the headphones.

But all of that was not my main concern - I was worried about the sound quality (taking into account my aging ears)!
The sound was nice and bright, very clear, and the bass was really strong. The best part is that these are very reasonably priced.  I'm budget-minded and have no one to impress with cool name-brand toys. Cowin was not a familiar name to me but I am impressed so far.

I'd recommend these headphones to anyone who appreciates good sound at a friendly price.

author: B. K
title: Things to consider
content:
Have them since February.
I use them when I walk to work and when using my riding lawnmower.
I was a little worried about some of the reviews stating the headphones cut in/out while using them. But I figured for 60 bucks I would give it a try. (earbuds and other headphones were either to heavy or outside ear would hurt)
I was pleasantly pleased with the sound quality and lightweight.
While walking to work I started to notice the sound cutting in and out, I was concerned, I should have listened to those reviews was going through my head. Noticed that it only did it while walking to work or if I moved my head to fast.
One day walking back from work, I removed my hoodie cause I was getting hot (midwest weather, morning cold afternoon hot) and the cutting in and out stopped. Did some more test and found that in NC the headphones were sensitive to my hood scraping against it or any slight touch to the headphones. Tested it out on my riding lawnmower (NC selected) and as long as nothing touched the headphones they worked as described. Now when walking to work and I need to wear my hoodie, I select BT and have no cut in/out issues.
Sound quality for 60 bucks is worth it. Haven't tried the handsfree phone part.
Weight.
I used them on my lawn tractor for 5 hrs straight (rolling the lawn) Never had any fatigue or headache. Zero, none!
Light as a feather.
All in all, there above average for that price. Battery life is excellent too.

author: Cameron
title: Great budget set of Noise Cancelling headphones
content:
The good:  They sound amazing! Battery life is great also (I charge mine about once a week with 3-6 hours of usage per day). And they are extremely comfortable

The bad: Once the battery gets to a certain point, the right speaker will "pop" so to speak when on noise cancellation and you make sudden movements. I assume it reacts a bit too slow at that point, or the cups suction slightly to my head causing a pressure difference.. It definitely has something to do with noise cancelling feature though. That is fine, flip to regular bluetooth, and that issue goes away.

Seller replaced one set for me, and the second set did the same thing, although not quite as bad as the first set.

author: Paul D Farber
title: VERY COMFORTABLE, noise cancellation is so-so
content:
I wore these on a 14+ hour flight to Beijing, then a 6 hour train to Shenyang and never felt uncomfortable and the battery lasted the ENTIRE time.  That alone is amazing.

The sound is very good and the ability to use a 3.5mm cable (to listen to in-flight movies) is VERY convenient.

NFC makes pairing super easy (ever try to pair a bluetooth device on an airplane?  Good luck finding your device when 100+ phones all show up on the bluetooth screen.  NFC means you just hold the phone to the headset and it connects.

The noise cancellation is noticeable, and does quiet down outside noise, and for a $60 headset its a good performer... but it does not silence the white noise completely on an airplane.  Music is not really affected by the noise cancellation and I was happy with the fidelity of the speaker.

The bad is a little to small for storage, the top cannot close.  Minor issue.

Very nice low end headset.

author: Steve
title: Great quality sound and longlasting
content:
I've had these headphones for 2-3 years and they have been amazing. I'll admit I haven't taken care of them the best but they have taken a beating. The sound quality is pretty good given the price range. I've used the noise cancellation a lot and have enjoyed how good they are at noise canceling. I wore them for at least 6 hours every day and I would say they're a 4/5 in terms of comfort. They recommend removing them every hour or so. But if left on long, it can become uncomfortable. The earpads and the overhead arch-thing are made of synthetic material and will wear down/detach from the headphones over time. Things like sweat will accelerate this breakdown. The design of them is simple, minimal and sleek. Some other headphones are ginormous or have too much going on in terms of design.

I would highly recommend these headphones! (Or get the newer version of these headphones found elsewhere on here).

author: Rogelio Sanchez
title: noise canceling, comfortable , and long lasting
content:
wireless beauty with shiny chrome
1st charge took about 4 or 5 hours to complete
linked to my galaxy s8 through bluetooth, easily,
set switch to active noise cancel
enjoyed music without ambient noise for hours (approx 6 hours total ) before got home and due to force of habit to recharge
once left overnight in on postion, still had charge (approx 9 hours)
soft earpads are a pleasure on the ears, but do get get hot and sweaty after an hour or two, just remove and let  your ears breathe for a few minutes then, replace, this is also stated in the manual.
with active noise cancelling ,  most noise under 40db is clearly muted or completely canceled,
noise or voices between 40db and 60db are garbled but muted
anything with a higher pitch or db , you should really pay attention to as it poses unsafe conditions
sounds and music come through clearly through the headset , has very decent range in highs and lows , not too much bass
included are charging usb cable and  nice bag for storing the headphones

author: Geoff Goddard
title: Great Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headset.  By far the best customer service I have experienced to date!!!
content:
Great Product, headset a little tight when new out of the box.  The sound is excellent.  Had an issue with the swivel breaking off unexpectedly 31 days after purchase.  Waiting to see how COWIN responds.

Update:  Just when you've lost all faith in customer service, you finally find the diamond in the rough!  I've added the response for your review.

This is Alina from Cowin Customer Delight. Let’s work together and find a solution.

Thanks for sharing your experience with the E7. We are sorry that E7 didn't live up to your expectations.

PLEASE: Give us a chance, - let us know how we can make you happy. We're more than happy to offer a full refund or replacement, or even a chance to try another E7 PRO product.

Our products are extensively tested for quality control. We do regular and frequent inspections. In over 10 years of business, we have maintained excellent quality and helped more than 50,000 homes and businesses with their needs. However, even with extensive testing, it is possible that some units might not be perfect. If that is the case, we stand by our products and our guarantee and are always happy to make things right.

We appreciate if you give our products another chance.

We are waiting for your response online 24 hours. :)

Have a nice day!

Alina
COWIN Customer Service Team

I made a simple request to have the item replaced and got this response which shocked me (This was actually fulfilled immediately as an upgrade from what I actually purchased,)

Hi

I am sorry that our headphones didn't make you feel satisfied. And I will give you a new one.
This is the free code:######################
link: https://www.amazon.com/Cancelling-Headphone-Bluetooth-Headphones-Microphone/dp/B077YG22Y9/ref=sr_1_6?ie=UTF8&qid=1530237866&sr=8-6&keywords=COWIN

You can use it purchase the same item in Amazon or the Upgrade Pro model. If the new one works ok,
Please leave me a feedback or review to let others know the item if it is convenient.
Your experience is very important to me and other customers.
If you have any question, please feel free contact me.
Have a good day
Lulu

author: W. Brown
title: Why buy COWIN headphones?
content:
I reported a small port issue one day and 24 hours later I have a new set of headphones. These folks go way out of their way to ensure their customers come first. That's important to me. And you don't have to tack on the cost of a good warranty on top of that. They insure their products 100% for 18 months.
Now the big question how good are the headphones. For the price you are paying these are truly great ones.
The sound is on the bass side and the noise cancelling feature cancels out everything except voices. which for me is great....they fit nicely over the ears gives a very gentle feel to the ears...and my ears are big....
Get these headphones for any use. You will not be disappointed. wow what a bargain and the company backs up their promise with action.

author: SCOTT. S
title: Great price, great sound, great range, comfortable.
content: Bought these as a replacement for the failed (after 2.5 yrs) Sennheiser RS120. There are some good upgrades with these that other wireless headphones miss. The active noise cancelling works terrific! These are over ear, more comfortable than the on ear. They're a little small cupped, round instead of oval, but positioning over normal size ears makes it doable and can wear for hours at a time. Best thing about these headphones are the RANGE, 60+ feet, other headphones cover ~33 feet, some homes are larger and you may hear lots of dropouts. These may drop outside the range, but pick it back up quickly upon a head turn. Of course, you have to have a transmitter capable of broadcasting bluetooth range of more than the headphone range and I chose the Avantree LONG RANGE trx/rx for that purpose. Good match, great sound, better than previous wireless I owned and certainly better than stock HDTV speakers. Volume controls are a little slow, but they get there. These also boast of 20+ hours of use, don't doubt it, but haven't tested them beyond 4 hours. For the range, sound and price, don't think there's anything on the market that clearly competes with this Cowin E-7.

author: SuperApis
title: Adequate - but you get what you pay for
content: I want to state that I think, for the price, these are perfectly good headphones. I realize that in not paying a premium, I should not expect premium performance. And so overall, I am happy with this purchase. But these headphones are not going to allow you to flip a switch and block out the noise in a coffee shop or other non-constant white noise.  The noise cancelling in these headphones is good enough to get rid of some white noise "hum" in the ambient background noise, but that's about it. Their other noise cancelling properties come largely from an earmuff effect - they physically block noise because they are large, over-ear headphones.  What this means for me is I can put these on in a noisy coffee shop and knock the noise down enough where I don't have to blast music into my brain to be able to work - which is a more pleasant way to work. But without music on, I am still in a coffee shop, listening to a dozen conversations, and having difficulty focusing.  So if you want headphones that take the edge off just enough to listen to music at a reasonable volume in a crowded place, these will do just fine. If you are expecting to flip a switch and mute the world, these will not do the job.

author: samK
title: Very middle of the road, not a bad place to start.
content:
Pros: Does a good job of cancelling noise and is relatively cheap. The sound is good for casual use.

Cons: So, there are others that have mentioned that the minimum volume is too loud. This is true if you are connected via blue tooth, the minimum volume is rather loud. If you connect with the cable it's much better.
I usually use it with the cable in an open office. Occasionally someone accidentally connects with with my headphones, annoying but rare.
My major complaint is that it beeps when the battery is low and it beeps loud. It will continue beeping while charging when it's below a certain mark so it's best to take them off and charge once it beeps.
These are cheap and the swivel joints will break damaging the circuitry. I've had two of these and they last about a year before the joints break (used 5x a week).

The reality: These are cheap and work fairly well. They will not block out people talking in your office but it will block out the sounds of the air system and reduce ambient noise. The low battery issue is easily prepared for but very annoying.
