(Original Review)
these headphones arrived today and i have been using them for a little bit. first off i guess i'm no audiophile because i don't hear anything other than the music. i have no complaints about the low end, highs, mids.. and nothing seems to be "bleeding" together. the weight is more "substantial" compared to my other headphones but i enjoy that - they seem very well balanced and fit snug without being uncomfortable. the padding around the ears is very soft. i could see wearing them for extended periods.

i have not tried the noise canceling function yet because it's quiet in my office.

my previous pair of headphones were a pair of sony wired on-ear i picked up for $30. these sound better than those, are more comfortable because of the extra padding and being over-ear, plus i have no wire to deal with (my main criteria!).

they paired to my macbook pro 13" with retina display no issues.

my only "complaint" is that the headphone's + / - button seem to be backwards. UP ( + ) is on the bottom and DOWN ( - ) is on the top. it would make more sense to me if that were reversed.

overall, pleased with the purchase. maybe problems will reveal themselves after more than a few hours.

1 Year Later...
So yeah, still very pleased with these headphones. I use them often for longer periods of time (2-3 hrs). They quickly switch between iPhone, iPad and 2 laptops without issue. The range seems to be pretty short, maybe 30 feet with no obstacles. I did take them with me on a trip to Europe and the battery lasted long enough (on and off use) to make it from Washington DC to Berlin with a layover (~15 hrs). I used the noise-cancelling function on the flights and it really does make a difference. It alters the music (makes it higher pitched maybe?) but I pretty much never heard the plane's engines.

All I can say is if you're on the fence, get them. You won't be disappointed.

author: Ricardo Lopez
title: Update Review
content:
Below is my original review for these headphones.  Cowin reached out to me and offered to send me their SE-7 noise-canceling headphones if I changed my review, or deleted it.  I told them if the headphones were good I would do so.  Why not?  I believe in second chances.

Well, the SE-7 is $20 more than the E-7, and they are the same garbage.  The noise-canceling doesn't work, the sound is crappy, not worth $89.  Save your money and buy yourself a set of Bose if you need a good set of noise-canceling headphones.  Due to this being their second chance and them coming up short once more, they went from two stars to one.  Plus the constant email harassment to delete my original review.

I wasn't going to write a review but I keep getting hounded to write a review or delete my original, so they asked for it.  Cowin needs to get their junk together.  See their email below.

Fisher Lawrence
5:05 PM (40 minutes ago)
to me

in case you missed the email that I sent about how to update or remove the comment
click your comment link below on laptop or cellphone web browser, login account, then you will be able to see a small button "delete review " Done
please make sure you logged your amazon account on your device (phone or laptop before clicking your comment link below or you will not see the "delete " or "edit " button

www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R3W1SJE31M04NQ/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B019U00D7K

Bad Headphones
Bought this to help study.  Unfortunately, the active noise cancellation does not work.  I hear the same with it on, as if it were off.  The sound quality when listening to music is atrocious.  Save your money and buy better headphones.

author: claire
title: Above expectations!
content:
Amazing amaaazing headset way above my expectations, sound quality is awesome plus noise cancellation. I use it everywhere and especially for gaming. Battery life is superb!! The colors fantastic!! I have recommended these to almost everyone as I have been using them for months now.

The few small things which can be improved is
1-the maximum volume is not high enough especially for gaming.
2-Also i have a thick neck so its not easy to walk around with them around my neck when i am not using them as they have a wide band.
3-mic is fine during gaming and normal voice calls as people can hear me fine but for some reason its not clear to others in some apps like google duo.

Cheers to the developers and all the best for your future ventures!!

author: Godofkoty
title: It's not easy finding a decent set of over the ear
content: I bought two pairs, one for each kid. It's not easy finding a decent set of over the ear, noise-cancelling headphones for less than $250 - and I did tons of research before I bought these. My kids both love them. They cut down on arguments b/c they can both enjoy their own music without disturbing the other one. They like the sound quality and they have not once complained about comfort even when wearing for hours at a time. I deduct two stars b/c one of them did come unglued 3 months after purchase, but I add back one star b/c the seller was incredible to deal with. I shot him a note via Amazon, he responded same day with a code for buying a replacement via Amazon (with free next day shipping) and I literally had the replacement set the next day. At t his price, I would recommend.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Best Headphones I've ever used
content:
I wear headphones for 10 to 12 hours a day.  I take online classes and listen to audio books to relax.  I have a massive music collection.  I can't tell you how many different headphones I've gone through over the last few years.  Actually I probably could since they were all ordered through Amazon.  Most of them start out nice, and then inevitably in about a month one speaker goes out and you are left with headphones that send sound to only one ear.

I have never used headphones more than I use this pair.  They have more than passed the test of time.  Additionally I find my daughters trying to copy me and wear them all the time.  Their toddler and infant hands have very little control so they get dropped.  Still they work perfect.

The noise canceling is remarkable.  I also like the fact that they don't require bluetooth you are welcome to plug them in old school.  I haven't tried it but it is one of the features of the headphones.

They connect no problem with my android phone, my ipad, my laptop, and my desktop.  Watching a movie with them is like being in the theater.  The sound is perfect, they are robust.  I will be sticking with Cowin whether it comes time to replace these or just get second pair.  I'd rather have a pair to travel with and a pair to keep at home just in case.

Based on all my headphone issues, these function and feel like they should cost 200 bucks.

author: Scholar
title: Cowin stands behind their product
content:
When the left earpiece of these headphones broke at the swivel (see photo) after ten months of ownership, in spite of my always careful handling, I contacted Cowin customer service, which immediately initiated a replacement process. They game me a 99% off discount code and link to order a replacement on Amazon.com. After submitting my proof of purchase, they credited me for the 1% that I paid. The replacement unit arrived promptly and in full retail packaging. This was clearly a material, design, or manufacturing failure, which Cowin to their credit remedied with a replacement unit, no questions asked.

As for the headphones themselves, the sound is very good and they are very comfortable to wear. The noise cancellation works well with daily commuting on mass transit, long car trips, and on commercial airline flights. In the latter case, I was able to use the included 3 mm audio cable the seatback entertainment center with excellent results.

I was disappointed at the failure of these $65 headphones after just ten months of use, but pleasantly surprised at the efficient and professional customer service. My replacement headphones have a two-year factory warranty (after warranty registration), so I will be able to enjoy these headphones for at least another two years, thanks to Cowin.

author: shijyuro
title: Took a chance and happy I did
content:
These are a very nice pair of headphones for the price especially considering the noise cancellation technology.  They are very easy to set up and connected with all my devices easily.  I'm not a very big fan of over the ear headphones because they are so bulky, which these are, but they are very comfortable.  The padding is very soft and they are adjustable so that they fit snuggly over my head without putting undue pressure on my glasses.  I am not an audiophile so would never consider spending the money for high end Beats or Bose headsets.  Having said that, I am more than happy with the sound quality.  I find the sound rich and vibrant.

I am a little annoyed at the controls.  The controls are not the same as the standard mic button controls for the iPhone.  The thing that annoys me the most about the button controls is that you can't access Siri through the buttons.

As for the noise cancelling technology, I am not sure what to expect since these are the first pair of headphones that I have purchased with this technology. And I have had them only for the weekend, testing them around the house.  The noise cancellation easily eliminates low pitch hums such as those produced by dishwashers, drier, washer, air conditioner, car engine, etc.  They do not, however, eliminate the repetitive sounds made, for example, by things such as the water swishing in the dishwasher or rapid clicking of the drier.  I later tested with a hairdryer and noticed no significant difference with the noise cancellation dis/enabled.  I bought these for air travel and have not had the chance to test them on a plane yet.  Hopefully they will cancel the engine noise sufficiently.

The last thing to note is that after using this for a short time, I noticed that I was getting a little dizzy and light headed.  A quick web search revealed that this is common with noise cancelling technology and that in most cases it resolves after using it for a while.  I hope that is the case for me.

Bottomline: These are solid headphones for the price.  I was actually looking for wireless headphones without noise cancellation.  I had expected noise cancellation to substantially increase the cost above what I wanted to pay. Then I came across these.  Given the good reviews and the added feature of noise cancellation, I decided to give it a try and am very pleased so far.

author: E. Tam
title: ⭐⭐ It will dull loud bass noises like airplane engines to a decent ...
content:
Mid range headphones with simple pros and cons.

1. Noise cancellation: ⭐⭐
It will dull loud bass noises like airplane engines to a decent quietness. However highs are completely ignored and come straight through. A crying baby, music and even conversations are easily audible with the active noise cancellation on.

2. Audio quality - ⭐⭐⭐
Highs are good, the bass is about average for a pair of headphones like these. You will find better bass with most ear buds. Audio clarity tends to be a. It muddled.

3. Build quality - ⭐
The plastic feels cheap and the button design could use some work. Think cheap 3rd party video game controllers and you'll get a good idea of how the buttons and material feel.

4. Battery life - ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
The only place where it shines. Its outstanding. I can't say how long the battery lasts. Because even with an entire day of heavy usage i've never had it die on me. I just charge it after 3-4 uses. I don't think ive ever gotten below 50% which makes sense since I've never used it for more than 5 hours in a day and the supposed battery life is 30 hours per charge.

author: Joani Nunez, Kindle Customer
title: Excellent Headphones - So Happy I Bought These!
content: I've had these headphones about a month now and use them every day. While I use them to listen to music at night to fall asleep to, I also use them during the day because I have a neighbor who's dog barks incessantly and there is major construction taking place next door. The noise cancelling feature works like a charm! It's made the days pleasant and tolerable again.  The battery lasts forever, and the headset is light - I sometimes forget I'm wearing them. Last but not least, whatever I listen to via these headphones sounds great! Clear, no distortion, excellent sound, including base. I am extremely happy with this purchase.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The noise cancelling element is great and the bluetooth works very well
content:
First, product: I bought these headphones early this year to use while studying. I am a PhD student. The noise cancelling element is great and the bluetooth works very well. This allows me to pace comfortably around my apartment while thinking without having to worry about a cable or hear the traffic outside. As far as the range on the bluetooth, it goes for a few rooms, but gets choppy if I go to the other end of my apartment. It really isn't meant for distance. Keep your phone in the room though and it is great. Sound quality is acceptable, but these are certainly not recording studio quality.

Second, customer service: about 2 months after I purchased them the bluetooth stopped playing in the right ear. I checked and they still worked fine with the cable. I emailed the company that night and within 12 hours they had offered to replace them and sent me a coupon code that covered the cost. Now I have a new pair that works great and I still have the broken pair that just works with the cable. I didn't have to bother with shipping it back or anything. These guys kick ass. Great experience.

author: Familia Rodriguez
title: Blocks out kids Screaming and Bickering
content:
Update: company contacted me apologizing for the defective product and they said they will be sending out a replacement, I will update my review fully once that happens. So far, i appreciate this company’s helpfulness:

My first Review is at the bottom. The current review for this product is this one of the top.

2nd review..

So I bought these for my child for his birthday and he just recently opened up and started using them, battery is still great and last a long time, the sound on these things are good. However the second pair that I bought have an issue with them when you are using the microphone. It sounds like there is a lot of electrical interference and you can hardly hear the person that is using them while they’re speaking to you. We have tried this on multiple different Devices and are still having the same issue. The person on the other line is unable to hear clearly the person speaking using the microphone of these headphones. Unfortunately my return window is now closed as of August 1, please do not buy these in advance for a birthday if you are wanting to do that. If you’re going to buy these make sure you open them and use them immediately or you will have just wasted your money if the product does not work as advertised.

1st review..
Battery lasts FOREVER! No, not really forever.. but at full charge I listen to music almost all day (8ish hours) plus, I can’t hear my kids fighting in the background 👏🏽 AT 👏🏽ALL!!!

Sound is great, battery lasts, the mic works just fine, auto connect, loud noise canceling (even when listening to an audio book on a high volume)

All in all a great deal.

author: EMaz
title: Excellent comfort; limited noise cancelling functionality
content:
There are almost zero options for active noise canceling below $200. Some headphones say 'noise isolating,' but I wasn't sure they would do enough, so I settled for the Cowin E-7.

First, the comfort is amazing. I can wear them for 8 hours without issue. It took me about a day to figure out how they should sit on my head, but once in position, they cover my ears do a good job of reducing ambient noise

Once you flip on the "NC" switch for noise canceling, you immediately notice where it falls short. Unlike more expensive units, these aren't reading the surrounding environment and generating a frequency to negate those sounds. Rather, they seem to produce a kind of fixed low frequency that feels like mild pressure in the ear and produces a kind of 'hissing static.'

The NC function will eliminate most low-frequency sounds (drone of the AC unit, footsteps, fingers hitting the keyboard of a laptop). Mids sounds further away (deeper voices, doors opening, moving things around on the desk). Highs come through mostly without any kind of reduction (laughter, people with higher voices, coffee cup set down.)

I wasn't sure what to expect with the NC function, but for the price, I'm not going to dock any stars because the Bose units cost considerably more. For the best experience, you are going to want to use the NC function and play some kind of background music. But if you want to remove all sound and not have to play music, I'd save for a set of Bose headphones.

I can't grade sound quality too harshly because my hearing is not tuned well enough to tell much of a difference between music playing at 96 kbps and 320 kbps. I will say that staging is really good - sounds meant to come from behind do sound like they are coming from speakers positioned behind the head; and vice versa with sounds from the front. Bass is okay. If you listen to hip-hop, you know that some boomy sounds can become distorted without a good subwoofer, and while the headphones mostly make a clean sound, some sounds break up. To me, the mids are really good and I think the highs hit all the right marks.

As for design, well, they are plastic. The chrome bit looks good at a distance but once up close you know where they saved money. If you want real metal, you have to pay for it. Personally, as long as the internals are good, I don't much care for the materials. Also, being plastic means they are relatively light. The 'leather' feels soft and there is loads of padding, especially with the part that sits on your head.

Be aware that these are not very low profile. Looking at the product image, they look smaller than they actually are. In reality, they are very wide.

The headphones connected to my laptop quickly enough, but if I switch them off then come back later and turn them on, sound won't come through until I turn them on and off a few times. I think the problem is the computer because they are 'paired,' but I can't be sure. It isn't a deal breaker.

No comment on battery life. They last a full 8 hours and you can plug them in while using them. Some peopel claim 40 hours, but there is no way to know how much battery life is left.

author: John T.
title: Poor sound and unethical business practices
content:
It didn't take long to realize these headphones had too much low frequency.  Without the noise cancelling the sound is completely different, sort of like listening to a very clean bass feed, a bit too vivid.  If you turn on noise cancellation, the bass dies down a bit, and the rest of the auditory frequency range comes to play, but it loses all definition and is unpleasant - almost an echo sound, boxed in.  Bottom line, the sound is not very good.  I will return it.

Update. After returning these headphones for a refund, I have received multiple overtures from the vendor asking me to change my rating from three stars to five stars. I was offered free headphones and doubled up refund. The final straw is when I was offered upgraded headphones if I would reconsider my position. I agreed to receive the new headphones and write a new review based on a truthful experience. The customer experience person then told me they would only ship the headphones if I FIRST deleted my review. I consider this kind of aggressive suppression of truthful reviews as a very unethical business practice. If they invested more in product quality and less in post customer experience and bullying, I would have given them a positive review to start with. Do not believe the positive reviews, they must be arrived at through unethical means because the product is very poor in quality. Please see credible reviews from CNET and others. You'll realize that apart from the many that get free stuff to say good things, this is a low quality product.

author: NixBoox
title: Noise canceling in a versatile and compact design.
content:
Nothing is more annoying than being on a plane that's delayed on the tarmack before take-off. People are still talking on the phone, children are still screaming and there's no hope of escape.  These Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, however, are perfect for making that experience less tedious.

These headphones are bluetooth but they come with a regular audio mini-plug connector so you can use them in a device that still has a headphone jack. This is great because it means you can use it with multiple devices without having to sync it to bluetooth on every device.  Bluetooth connectivity is good and didn't drop any sound when turning my head from side to side like some headphones are prone to do.

The noise cancelling is great. I've had wired ANC headphones that didn't do the job as well as these bluetooth ones.  The audio is very good too, much better than many more expensive versions that I've also tried.

The headphones come with a small leather traveling pouch which is nice, but a hard-sided case is available on Amazon that would give the phones more protection if you're traveling a lot.  I haven't had any problems with the leather pouch but I do worry about losing the aux cable.

Excellent product, I will definitely buy again.

author: KRB61
title: Not so good at canceling noise
content: I really like the design and sound quality of these headphones. They pair quickly and easily. I’m giving only 3 stars because the noise canceling isn’t that good. When I switch them to the NC setting without using music, a pc , or the like , I hear as much noise as if I had them off. When playing music, the NC setting works fairly well, but only if I have the volume 50 to 100 percent. I will keep them because of the sound , build , and style quality, but as far as noise canceling, I am not happy with the lack of being able to block out unwanted noise. The unit was fully charged so I cannot understand why I have to play music loudly to block out noise. I had high hopes that these would give me some peace and quiet with the NC setting on and being used alone or with music.

author: Lucas DJG
title: Fits over big ears and works well for travel
content:
These headphones are sturdy and comfortable. The build-quality is really impressive and the packaging was fancy. The sound quality is extremely good for this price range and I am happy with listening to music or podcasts. The bass is just right for me, but some may think it is a little light. For headphones it is better than you could expect.

AS FOR FIT/FEEl: These are the most comfortable headphones I have had. I am sure some of the super expensive ones are good too, but I have had several from this price range and a few that were about three times as much and these are the very best. They are wide enough if you have a big melon, like me, but snug enough that my wife can wear them on her notably smaller head.  The padding on the over the head crosspiece is nice and soft, but feels like you could accidentally rip it if you are overly rough with your electronics. To be fair, I have been using them a lot and have not been super careful, but mine is just fine.  My very favorite part about these headphones are the ear-cups. They are big enough to fit over my large ears without scrunching them up. I also wear glasses and the pads make a good seal without making my glasses uncomfortable.

The noise cancelling feature is nice, but it only works with quite low noise.  It works fine for commercial airline noise, but is not good enough for something like a small private plane. These would not be suitable for mowing either, but I did use them while trimming with a gas trimmer and it was okay for that, so it is a mid-range low noise that it works best for.

author: Scooter J
title: Almost perfect and great for the price
content: I have only used these for airplane travel, connected to my iPad. They work well for the most part. In my bedroom when I tried them for the first time, there was a weird sound thing going on. I finally realized that somehow the ceiling fan and the frequency were colliding and I was hearing distortion matching the rotation of the fan. It was actually painful. If I reached up and touched the sides of the headset, the noise would stop. But, I wasn’t going to be sitting in my bedroom so I didn’t send them back (because they are really inexpensive for Bluetooth noise cancelling headphones. On to the plane I went. Started my show and there was none of that weird sound in my brain. Every now and then, if I turned my head to either side, I’d hear a little distortion, but staring directly at the screen, it was perfect. The noise cancelling is perfectly tuned for airplane noise. I could hear it slightly in the distance, but for the most part had a wonderfully full and loud listening experience. I watched “Bohemian Rhapsody” and forgot where I was and may have sung out loud in the plane once. If you want inexpensive, good noise cancelling, and good sound quality, they worked really well.

author: AmazonShopperDavid
title: WOW. I'm impressed!
content:
I just upgraded my iPhone and I wanted to buy myself an nice set of headphones as a treat. I listen to lots of music. I figured I'd look at the bose and the beats. Every time I did a search for noise canceling headphones these kept popping up. I'd look past them. But then they'd pop up again. The high end headphones are pretty expensive. So I figured I'd give these a try for $70. Worst case I'd send them back and buy something better. But WOW. THEY SOUND GREAT!  Nice and clear and crisp. Great range of sound.  Nice balance. Not too heavy. Great range at both ends of the sound spectrum. The noise canceling nicely lowers ambient sound. The headphones are light weight and very comfortable to wear. And the battery charge is great. They came charged. I've been listening here for 3 hours just relaxing. James Taylor. Boston pops. Trans Siberian orchestra. Garth brooks. I've tried a nice mix. I'm very pleased. They paired easily. Only annoyance as others mentioned is the volume controls are reversed. Top button lowers sound and bottom raises it. Very well made and comfortable to wear. They seem built to be quite durable and very high quality. They feel high quality in the hands and on the head. They even come with a storage bag. No charger. Only a cable. But they will charge from any USB charger.

Update over a year later. I'm still loving these headphones. I recently tried in a set of beats. And compared backnand forth. I'd argue these sound just as good. I'm still lovin them. Listen to music nearly every night and these are wonderful.

I wasn't sure from the description of there was a built mic for taking phone calls. But I've taken a couple calls here now and people seem to be hearing me no problem.

Now time to drag my butt out of the recliner. But what a nice relaxing time with a headphones that seem to work much better than one would expect from the price. Definitely a keeper. Maybe I'll go after a high end pair some day. But for now these seem to work wonderfully.

Update 2/15/17. WOW. I LOVE THESE HEADPHONES!  The sound is wonderful. I have many hours in them now. They are comfortable to wear. They are very well made. They are built heavy enough to not feel cheap. But not heavy on head at all. Music is wonderfully clear. Highly recommend these. Seem to be far better performance than I expected for the price.  And I just noticed another cool feature when paired with the iPhone 7. There is a headphone indicator that appears to right of screen and next to it is a battery level indicator for the headphone battery. Nice!

author: I Feel Fine
title: Keep the box for the return - BEEPING DEATH
content:
I've owned these for a couple of weeks.  The instructions are anemic and no help at debugging.

I get a single blue flash every two seconds.  And five flashes every 60 seconds.  The five flashes are matched with a super irritating chime.  It's loud.  I can still hear the beeping even with the headphones wrapped in a towel and thrown in a steel drawer.

I took a day off from the office leaving the headphones on my desk.  It irritated my coworkers all day long.  Embarrassing.

No way to turn the headphones off.  No way to charge the headphones.  The "user replaceable" battery is protected by a hologram/label which I assume breaking invalidates the warranty.

There's no way to stop the beeping.  I tried laying them flat on the headphones.  The "noise canceling" technology knocked off a decibel or two (as in, did nothing).

And just to rant at a whole new level...  Every pair of bluetooth headphones I've owned play warning chimes through the speakers.  This is the first pair that does it relentlessly, whether the device is on or off.  I know in the grand scheme of things, who cares, first world problems, wah.  But this chime feature is so useless and avoidable.

author: Small Town Man
title: Not bad for the price
content:
They aren't great, but they also aren't $300. They do a decent job of canceling out noise. Although I can still hear all my kids yelling in the back of the suburban. But worse then that, is that I can hear my wife yelling at me, that I have my headphones on and I'm ignoring everyone while I'm driving. So she has to deal with all of it. I wonder if there is a pair I can get that will cancel out a wife's voice?

The sound quality is good. I mainly listen to audio books so I don't need great sound. They are comfortable. I've worn them for a few hours at a time and not had any issues.

The mic is crap. The 1 person I tried to talk to with them on could only hear 30% of what I said. Those were his actual words. So for music/audio books they are great. If you have to take a phone call you have to take them off and use your phone.

author: AJD
title: Arrived broken (EDITED)
content:
(Will edit when situation is resolved). I was quite excited to find these headphones- they were reasonably priced, had good reviews overall, and did not look cheap. They arrived quickly, UNFORTUNATELY the headphones were broken upon arrival. The right speaker does not work nor does the bluetooth option work. I gave it two stars for now because it is comfortable and the customer service seemed willing to work to fix the problem, waiting to hear back from them. Hope to get this fixed soon.

(EDIT 1) 9/14/2018: After dealing with Cowin customer service and receiving a new product I'm going to bring it up to 4 stars. The headphones are working well, the sound seems to be well balanced between the highs and mids the bass is kind of struggling. But overall it is a great bang for your buck.  Now customer service was good,, they handled the problem quickly and efficiently.  Happy with the transactions.

(Edit 2) It's been approximately 4 months and the product is still working well. My only issue with it right now is that it does not stay on my head during workouts, but they aren't an athletic headphone so it is to be expected. They have been holding their charge for a really long (I forget to turn them off sometimes and find them still running the next evening). Would definitely buy again, especially at this price.

author: Sara
title: Audio quit after half of travel
content: So I was excited about this purchase.  I had done some research and was excited to find a product that appeared to work almost as well as the gold standard of Bose at a fraction of the price.  I was not expecting perfection, I was hoping for good audio and comfort from noise cancellation on LONG overseas flights.  At first all went well.  Charged well at home and appeared to work wonders with noise cancellation and sound was good on my iPhone, my iPad and my computer, not that my computer was going on a backpack trip to Frankfurt and Paris.  On the flight to Frankfurt, all went well, the noise cancellation worked perfect and the sound from my iPhone and the plane audio was good.  Got to Frankfurt and tucked it away till I needed it again.  Traveled in a case designed specifically for Cowin headphones and all seemed well.  Traveled to Paris, no problem.  Charged it the night before we were heading home.  Light came on to indicate charge and all seemed well until I got on the plane and tried to hook up to the audio on the plane.  Noise cancellation still worked, but it did not matter the cable I used, and I tried THREE cables, the audio did not work from the plane, from my iPhone or from my iPad.  It appears that I am out of the return window for Amazon, so I am S.O.L. and not really happy, but glad that I did not spend THAT much money.  Maybe I should have gone ahead and purchased a Bose set of headphones.  I will have to save up my money for those.  Maybe good to purchase these if you travel quick after you purchase them and are able to return them after your trip when things go south.

author: Kyle Morris
title: I love these headphones
content:
I love these headphones. The noise canceling actually surprised me. To test them I tried speaking to someone with them on. They work better than some earplugs that I've used in the past.

This is the first Bluetooth headphones I've owned so I experimented a bit with them. The signal will go 20' through 2 walls before it starts getting garbled up, at 30' you have no sound. I'm not sure how far it will go unobstructed though my home has too many walls in the way.

The life expectancy will vary depending on whether or not you leave them on all day or not. The longest I have had these going is about 8-12 hours non-stop while I played a game on a weekend. If I get a low power tone after 12 hours, which goes off quite often until you plug it in. Which is helpful for alerting you to the fact they are about to die, but rather aggravating to listen to.

If the headset dies it comes with a cord to plug into your computer via USB port to charge it back up, which takes 30 min to an hour. Considering how long they run between charges I don't mind waiting another hour before using them again.

These headphones also have a auxiliary port for non blue tooth listening. This works just as well as the blue tooth. I personally feel like the cord is a bit short though.

The buttons on the side work depending on what you are doing and in what application. Music you can turn up or down or skip the song. It doesn't seem to have any affect on videos.

All in all I love these head phones and recommend them since they can be worn for longer periods of time without hurting your ears, and the noise cancelling part makes every thing way quieter.

author: ClintonR
title: Not as durable as I would have liked, otherwise pretty good.
content:
Two years in, faux leather has peeled of in many places and the swivel mount of the left ear has failed making them mostly useless at this point. The sound is good, noise canceling is good, user friendly. I would have liked the "over ear" size to have been a bit bigger but for $60 it's a pretty fair deal over all. Consider buying the additional 3yr warranty.

Edit 9/30/2019: Contacted via text by representative claiming to represent the manufacturer, offered replacement or refund on product. I declined the refund but said I would gladly accept a replacement. The representative asked that I first delete this review to being the process. I again declined. No idea if this was a scam, but if this is COWIN's idea of PR, it's a horrible practice. If you genuinely want people to like your company and or product, just do the right thing and replace items without question when they are obviously sub par materials/construction. I'm downgrading my rating from 3 stars to 1 star due to this further negative experience.

author: Raven
title: Actually better than my Bose SoundLink II
content:
Better sound than what I get from my 6-month old wireless Bose SoundLink II which is surprising considering the cost of the Bose pair. And I do not think that the Bose headphones are defective either, but after getting this pair and comparing the sound, I think that the Bose pair may be over-hyped and consequently overpriced.

It's kind of like the situation with Reebok's, Nike's, and Beats earphones. As long as the brand has enough street-cred among a certain clientele, a "classiness" label gets attached to the brand and a higher quality rating becomes more a result of assumption rather than objective evaluation against less-known peer brands. I don't really blame so much the customers for this though as I do marketing departments.

On another hand I do not know how long these will last; they seem sturdy but considering the nice sound quality for a much lower price, I thought perhaps they wont last as long as the Bose pair. If they stop functioning I will come back and update this review.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bluetooth Stopped working after 3 months*** Updated Review*** 10/31/19
content:
Buyer beware... Bluetooth stopped working after 3 months.

Update.. We just had the 2nd pair we bought BT crap out... Lesson learned.. Will just buy higher end headphones. The sad thing is.. these have great sound for the price..

***Updated Review*** 10/31/19

Cowin actually called me on the phone and offered to make this right without any money out of my pocket. This is some of the best customer service that I have received in a day and age where it has become sell the product and forget the customer. So make it right they did. They sent me a pair of the E8s. So here is my review for those..

E8s.. right out of the box you can tell these are built better than the E7s.. They are really comfortable and not too heavy. noise cancelling is much better with these. Now I run a DJ business and have multiple headphones. So where to compare these. I like these better than the Beats for comfort and sound wise not much difference. Not as much bass but you can edit that with a good equalizer. For the price point these are really good head phones. Are they my favorite.. no.. I have a pair of Audio Technica that I love and paid way too much for.. But these are a close second.. But there customer service is easily number 1..

author: Nglover
title: Would happily buy these again!!!
content:
Let me start off by saying that I love these headphones!

My only comparison that I have to these are a pair of BOSE quiet comfort 35 ii. These head phone obviously preformed slightly less and the aforementioned, but so much better than I was expecting.

I bought these ANC headphones becuase I recently started working on solo projects at work in a call center and needed to block some of the chatter out.These headphones did just that!

They don't cancel out the direct talking within 5 to 10 feet, but they do dramatically reduce (75-80 percent) the further away conversations. And this is what they are advertised to do.

The sound quality is great. I have messed with any we settings on my phone and it sounds like the conversations from the podcast I listen to are happening right there by me.

Bluetooth pairing is a breeze and the connect is amazing. Without barriers the headphone stay solidly connected over 150 feet from my phone.

Battery life on these is phenomenal. I would have been pleased with 10 hours or so, but I have gotten around 3 times as much. (I started to record exactly how long, but after about 20 hours I stopped) I listen to podcast that are over an hour long and was easily able to make it through 25 before it made it to the low battery beep. I have repeated this again and again all the while with ANC on.

On to comfort. I wear these headphones off and on for 8-10 hours a day at work. I have worn them a couple time for 4 hours straight and the whole time there was no discomfort or pains.  The ear cushions are nice and padded and the band is well covered too.

Pros:
Battery life
Sound quality
Noise cancelling
Quality packaging

Cons:
Slightly cheaper materials
Fingerprints show on the shiny surfaces

I am going to be purchasing a pair of these as a gift for someone soon and if I ever have to replace mine, I will definitely look back at these or COWIN's other offerings!!!

author: Ruth K.
title: Great headphones, but......
content: This is actually my second pair of these.  The first pair held up to years of abuse and I loved them, and recommended them to several coworkers.  One of the best features, in my opinion, was that even if I forgot to charge them I could plug them into my phone and still use them as headphones without the noise canceling.  I was quite disappointed to get my new pair and discover that they'd removed that feature.  I'm certinally hoping that this pair lasts as long as my first pair, but once I have to replace these I may look elsewhere, as that feature was valuable to me.

author: Pianist
title: Pairing problem - buyer beware
content:
Bought the "COWIN E7 Active Noise Cancelling Headphones Bluetooth Headphones with Mic Deep Bass Wireless Headphones Over Ear" on March 30th.

I was able to get it paired up the first time - it took a while, but eventually it worked. I was able to use the headphones and I enjoyed them.

I recently rearranged the position of my computer and unplugged/replugged everything... and found that my headphones were no longer paired, and I cannot get them paired up with the computer.

When I turn on the headphones, windows immediately recognizes them (the bluetooth notification shows that I have "1 connected") and asks me to "Add a device  Tap to set up your" When I click this prompt, I get:
"Your app would like to pair to the device 'your device.' Enter a pin to pair." I enter 0000 (or anything for that matter) and eventually it says "Bluetooth headset  connection failed."
As I'm sitting here writing this post Windows keeps re-recognizing the headphones and asking me to add a device/set up your _____...

It's worth noting that I never did anything with entering a pin the first time I set them up and they worked.

Customer service was very prompt in getting back to me after my first email request, however their solution did not work, and now they're not responding.

edit: They eventually responded and were pretty prompt in giving me a refund. Changing to 2 stars.

author: Vince
title: Music quality is full bodied, comfort is unparralleled and they have have a long battery life
content: These are some of the best headphones I've ever had, no I'd hazard to say THE best I've ever had and believe me I've been fooled into thinking that if you spend 3-400 dollars on a pair of headphones in the past that you'll get better sound or quality, then wound up needing to get a new pair after 3-4 months due to shoddy workmanship or just bad sound quality. These offer a nice full bodied sound, not too much bass, not too much treble so you get all the beauty of the music as you listen. The noise cancelling feature is spot on, allowing me to bask in my music as I draw or sketch and relax, plus the battery life is amazing! After several days of use (heavy use I might add) I have only needed to charge them once! The conmfort as I wear them is unparralleled which is a big deal to me since I listen to music the majority of my days and other headphones would cause my ears to ach after several minutes or an hour. These headphones are just amazing, Cowin has made a fan out of me!

author: Mathew
title: Quality for low price.
content:
Very nice headphones. Actually the best I have ever owned.  Sound quality is awesome.
.
Noise cancelling... Noise cancelling feature blocks out most noises. I wore these on a long flight watching movies. Simply putting them on made things quiet. When I flipped on the noise cancelling feature it silenced about 75% of background including the plane engines. But certain tones cut right through the high tech feature. I could hear this lady talking clearly while everything else was silenced.  I am sure you can spend a ton of money and get a better pair but for the price these are a good deal.
.
Quality... these are well made with soft leather pieces. Adjustable to your head size. Even comes with a leather bag. I am not sure about the 30 hour battery life claim but they did last me more than 10 hours no problem. Maybe they still had another 20 hours? I am sure they would be destroyed if you gave them to a child. But for an adult who takes care of things I dont see them breaking.
.
Functionality... these are a bit bulky but that is the nature of this type. Controls are simple enough. But I can't figure out why you push and hold the down button to turn music up. Seems backwards to me but that's a minor thing. The bluelight being on constantly is annoying but a good reminder that you have left these on when you take them off.
.
Overall these are a sweet deal for the price I paid. A must when I take my next flight!

author: Rachel
title: Very Pleased with my Cowin E-7 Active Noise Canceling Headphones
content:
I was really interested in trying out this product. I was in the market for noise canceling headphones, as I travel a lot for work, but I was not willing to spend top dollar for them. (mostly because I was not convinced I would be able to tell the difference.)
The Cowin E-7 Active Noise Cancelling Wireless Bluetooth Over-ear Stereo Headphones - Black is a less expensive version of noise canceling headphones and so far I am really enjoying them.

Size, Style, Comfort:
These headphones are adjustable in size and easy to store away for travel since the ear pieces turn to make the headphones flat. I found the cushions of the headphones to be extremely comfortable. In terms of style, I think they are subtle and get the job done. They are not making a fashion statement, but they still look good when you are wearing them.

Price, Durability:
I 100% recommend these headphones for their price--especially if you are in the market for good quality headphones and do not care about having the top brand. I found the headphones to be very light (Great for traveling!) but not as if they were about to break. I will check back in September after my first trip with them.

Ease of Use:
Since I have the Iphone &, i was specifically looking for a pair of Bluetooth noise canceling headphones (I find this much easier than trying to keep track of the small little converter.) The instruction manual that came with the headphones was simple and easy to follow, I was able to set it up on my phone and laptop. I really liked the sound quality and found that they canceled noise compared to normal headphones.

author: KodiakWildHolmes
title: they sound good. i thought i liked having a dedicated "off" ...
content:
they sound good. i thought i liked having a dedicated "off" switch, but in the month or so since i've had them, i've forgotten too many times to turn them off at the end of a work day, thereby leaving them on for at least 8 to 10 hours overnight, so i kind of miss the headphones that switched off automatically after 5 or 10 minutes of inactivity.

phone connectivity seems to function fine.

my line of work is hard on headphones, especially the overly swivelly design that seems so prevalent these days ( and is so easy to break ), but for normal use, i guess they're durable enough.

author: Dr. J
title: Just okay....
content:
UPDATE: I've added an extra star for the superb customer service received. Minutes after leaving my review, customer support reached out and offered to send a complimentary pair. Initially I thought from their email that it would be a different pair, however I received the exact same pair. Regardless, it was kind of them to quickly send a second pair as they definitely did not have to do so.

-----------------------------------------------
I purchased these before going out of town on a 3 hour flight, and was initially encouraged after reading the previous reviews. Unfortunately my experience was completely underwhelming. I put them on for the first time outside while waiting for the train to the airport, and was immediately disappointed in the overall quality.

These headphones function as they should, but are by no means "great". Multiple reviewers indicate that they are comfortable around the ears for at least 1-2 hours; I found the reverse, they squeeze tightly almost immediately. The inside area (where your ears should comfortably fit) is small, which means the cushion will overlap part of your ear and squeeze it. I saw several reviews that mentioned these were great for large heads. I don't think my head is abnormally large, but I wanted to err on the side of caution (I'd rather have too much room than not enough). They do not extend out much at all, and the more you extend the tighter the squeeze will be.

Now, on to sound quality. Noise cancellation is a solid 4. Not the best, but they certainly reduced the amount of "noise pollution" on the flight. There is minimum base, which always is a disappointment. I don't need the bass to be so strong that my brain is vibrating, but I don't want my music to sound like talk radio either. Volume was also an issue, as on and off the plane the maximum volume is low (I'm also not hard of hearing).

Charge time: I charged the headphones overnight the evening before flying out, and they held a charge for the duration of my trip (5 days).

Phone conversation: My friend was able to hear me relatively well through the bluetooth speaker while have a phone conversation, so 5 stars for that at least.

Summary: These are top of the line for headphones in the cheaper range maybe, but I wouldn't purchase them again, especially not for the price I paid. I have some wired headphones that I bought on Groupon for $30 (link included) that are old but have much better sound quality and extend further; the only sorta-issue is the cord, but they are much better quality than these.

Able Planet Sound Clarity Active Noise Canceling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)

author: Sklar
title: Unbeatable for the price
content:
The sound and feel of the E7 headphones is fantastic! I can wear them all day at work and they are very comfortable. The noise cancellation is very good. It completely tunes out other noises in the office.

I have 2 minor complaints, but doesn't take away from a great pair of headphones.

1) The volume up/down buttons seem to be reversed. I hold down up to turn the volume down and vice versa. (Also, I wish skipping songs was holding it down and volume was tapping, but not a big deal)

2) While the bass and mid tones are very very good, I wish there was slightly more treble from them. Again they still sound amazing, but I'm just being really picky.

Would recommend them to anyone and would absolutely buy again

**UPDATE**
I had an issue with my headphones after about 51 weeks of use.  I contacted Cowin and they helped me get a replacement immediately.  Great customer service needs to be recognized!  Well done Cowin!  Will order your products again.

author: Atharva Chitre
title: Extremely Comfortable
content:
Be sure to watch the full video review of the product
Bluetooth Headphones come in all shapes and sizes and within this range of products come products that fit an ear perfectly and comfortable. So would be the description of these pair of headphones. Here is a full written description of the main aspects of this headphone.

Price:
The price seems quite reasonable for the battery life and the soft ear cups.

Build Quality:
The build quality is perhaps overly sturdy as the swivel frame is made out of thick materials. This is also the point which is a weakness for many headphones. This is so because the ear cups are rotated quite a lot of times meaning that a good construction of this area results in better quality:

Sound Quality:
The sound quality is decent but surely isn't an audiophile level product. The treble and the bass have a decent combination but there could have been a little more bass. The noise cancellation feature is quite decent and works to cancel out background noise.

In Conclusion I recommend this product for its long battery life, and good construction quality.

*I received this product for free in return for an honest and unbiased review.

author: ScrappyHappyMama
title: Got these twice, broke both times. This is a generous rating.
content:
Got these headphones for Christmas over a year ago. They work great, cancel noise pretty well, and feel very comfortable. Plus, it has a nice long battery life, and charges relatively quickly.
However, only after a few months, the right ear started to come loose. The plastic inside had just worn out. I tried to deal with it, but it couldn't even stay on my ear.
Not long after, I decided to give them another chance, and I bought another pair.
That was a mistake. The exact same thing happened (this time on the left ear), and it broke even quicker than the last ones.
They weren't mishandled. I was just walking and the left ear popped out.
Such a shame that good headphones are made with such cheap plastic.
Don't buy this if you're looking for headphones that will last more than a couple of months.

author: RickyRic
title: Beyond Effective
content:
I recently bought these headphones because I was headed to Vegas and the flight would be long, so I wanted something to help keep out the noise of the plane. Best decision I've made. These worked surprisingly well. There was an annoying child on the plane who kept speaking loudly and crying for the majority of the flight (you know the usual, the child who's damn parents refuse to tell them to shut the heck up)!! Anyway, once I realized what was happening, I took these bad boys out, put them over my ears, plugged in the a/v cord that came with them into the tv screen on the plane, and that was the last I heard of that annoying child. Moreover, the best part, the headphones blocked out the noise from the plane and also stopped my ears from clogging. I was extremely surprised by how effective they are.

On a questionable note, I have used them on Bluetooth mode to listen to music and watch videos on my computer. I noticed that sometimes it drops the connection. I am not sure if that is an issue with my computer or the headphones so I will continue to monitor the situation. However, b/c I bought them for their noise cancellation abilities and b/c they work great in that regard, I am not lowering my rating for the Bluetooth issue. For their price point and effectiveness, they are a must buy!

author: Rusty Pang
title: BEST VALUE product and service
content:
I originally bought these headphones based upon reviews 8 months ago. At the 7-month mark, they broke. The plastic holding the right speaker broke so it was only being held together by the speaker cable.

My wife threw away the headphones after a week, so I thought I was out of luck. I contacted Cowin anyways and explained the situation. They decided to replace my headphones free of charge, so I now have a new set coming. YEAH! Thanks Cowin.

So, I wanted buyers to know that even if you feel a little shaky about trying Cowin out, I think their customer service has your back.

Regarding quality, this isn't Bose, but it doesn't have to be. The noise cancellation is superb and the battery life is excellent. I sometimes go an entire day without charging them. Now, that doesn't mean I am listening to audio the entire day, but I've had flights that totalled to 17+ hours of travel. Having the ability to cancel out the ambient noise of an airplane cabin is a God-send.

There are two flaws that I have to share for future models. The blue LED light is bright in the dark, so if you are sleeping with a partner, they may have to deal with a blue light blinking while you wear them. The other improvement I would make is in the microphone quality. I was excited to know that I could answer calls with the headphones, but people on the other side can't hear me very well. I decided to stop using the headphones for calls.

Other then that, I think you will find it very difficult to find headphones of equal quality at this price.

author: Rudy Toody
title: Tune-out your noisy neighbors.
content: I got these for noise cancelling. I'm retired and working on my computer at all hours and I get distracted by neighbors and traffic noises. Not anymore! The first night, I was able to tune-out three neighbors and the traffic noise. These work great!

author: Ricardo
title: Customer Service is amazing!
content:
I have had these headphones since September 2018 and I cannot imagine myself without these headphones! I am a college student and it is extremely important to me that I block out as much distractions from my work environment. They are comfortable, look good, and sound amazing! I highly recommend this if you are a college student just because it really does block out the background noise so you can focus on your homework. Its amazing. I am so happy I got these headphones.

As for customer service. It is out of this world!! The left side of my headphones recently stopped working. Sometimes I would not be able to hear on my left ear and sometimes I would. So I contacted customer service about it and they were extremely understanding. So understanding that they sent me another pair of headphones! I was amazed because these aren’t cheap headphones! The customer service is amazing and the product is amazing.

author: rebyrd53
title: They quit working after one month
content: My son used these for one month after Christmas.  Suddenly, they quit connecting through Bluetooth.  The power button would still light up when switched to noise canceling, but they would not connect.  When we googled the problem, it is apparently a common issue.  Luckily I purchased from Amazon and was able to return, I had 2 days left.  I did request a replacement pair, but I must admit I'm not very hopeful.  Try other headphones before buying these.

author: Helen
title: Nothing a little duct tape won't fix...
content:
Great sound, great feel, but the construction quality lacks.  I purchased these along with a hard shell case.  For 6 months these were amazing.  I had two coworkers buy them after trying them out.  We loved them.

Things didn't begin to go south after 6 months.  All 3 pairs (including my coworker's headphones), broke due to a design flaw at the swivel point just above the ears.  The small threaded pin that holds them in place and allows them to swivel stripped, causing the headphone to fall apart.  Had they used a metal swivel pin, this likely wouldn't have happened.

author: Zahra
title: Not for Music Lovers/ Audiophiles/ Professionals
content:
UPDATE: Several months after my purchase, customer service reached out to me about the issues I was having. I increased my rating from 1 star to 3 stars for this reason, as the representative was very sweet and accommodating (Thank you, Lexi). I do not support the philosophy of this company, however, as they tried to coerce me into deleting my negative review for a free pair of upgraded headphones. Whereas I do appreciate the upgraded headphones I received (still not the greatest quality), I thought that was very duplicitous and could not in good faith support that kind of deception- especially as a customer who purchased this item BECAUSE of all the great reviews. That being said, if you are willing to spend a little more money but still not as much as a pair of Beats etc., Cowin's E8 headphones are a much better option (warning: they beep every time a song skips, every time you touch your phone screen, get a notification, touch a control button etc).
*****************************************************************
Original Review:
Oh my god I want to cry. I bought these headphones as a gift for my brother, who fortunately finds no issue with them (he is so excited to have wireless earmuffs) but when I tested them out for myself I immediately noticed they were NOT worth the sale cost. The basic Apple headphones I received with my iPhone 8 were better than these, and audiophiles do not speak very highly of Apple headphones.

So disappointed. Will not be purchasing anything from Cowin in future.

Pros:
- Looks very stylish (silver details are plastic however, not metal)
- Came with a soft carrying case
- Contributes toward UNICEF fund
- Simple to use
- Very comfortable

Cons:
- Sound is distorted (WHY COWIN, WHY? Is my item broken or what???)
- LoFi audio (Sounds like cheap dollar store quality)
- Noise cancellation is very minimal
- EXPENSIVE for the above mentioned issues.

These headphones should not be marketed as HQ/HD music headphones.

author: Boo
title: I Can't Recommend These BUT I Do Recommend the Seller
content:
The Con: They are hot and your ears will sweat. They are not noise-cancelling.  I still hear every single word coming from the television while my husband watches TV.  Purchased them in early June. It is now mid-November, not yet 6 months, and they are falling apart. One ear piece keeps dangling; I keep pushing it back in, yet it continues to react to gravity and begin to dangle.
The Pro: They are comfortable on the ears, if hot.  The are easy to pair and remain connected. They hold a charge reasonably well.
Conclusion:  Granted, I paid only $62.99 compared to those available for hundreds of dollars but that $62.99 is pretty pricey for me. I'd say that averaging at a cost of $12.60 a month is wasteful. Didn't even get a full six months out of them. Don't buy.
(And, no, I did not contact the company. Perhaps I ought, but I won't. I'll just look for a different pair.)

author: C
title: Revised
content:
In April 2019, I purchased two sets of these headphones, one for me and one for my son. I sent mine back immediately when I saw that the headphones need to be powered on to work with the direct cable connection. Why? A direct cable connection should have the option of working without power (and without noise cancelling), like Audio-Technicas.

Now my son's headphones quit. They connect easily via Bluetooth, but there is sound only from one side, it is intermittent and distorted. I see no physical damage. It is too late to send them back to Amazon. Noise cancelling never worked.

On the pro side, they look okay (a bit garish for me), are fairly comfortable, and have a reasonable battery life.

But, they are junk. I made a warranty claim, but I do not think they are worth more than the cost of return postage, even if I got a brand new pair (and the warranty allows them to send refurbs).

I find it hard to believe all the 5 star reviews are legitimate.
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________
I am raising my review from one star to three stars because the company sent me a brand new replacement E7 and E8 when I initially complained. Both at no cost to me. I have not had a chance to test the replacement E7 or the free E8. When I do, I may revise this review again.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________________

author: YoYo Productions
title: These are the real deal. The best bang for your hard-earned buck.
content:
These headphones are an amazing deal. I have tried many brands ranging from Bose to Senheisser to Beats and not a single one of them offer a combination of noise cancelling and sound quality this good at this price.

Noise Cancellation: They won't be able to block that annoying coworker that's driving you nuts with his obnoxiously loud voice. However, they will completely make disappear that droning a/c unit noise. I tried them on a 6 hours plane flight and while I was at the first row of the plane, they were able to cancel at least 50% of the engine noise which in turn helped reduce fatigue. So for sort of whiteish noise, they work great. For others, you are better off with earplugs.

Sound Quality: These E7s can really pump some deep base notes. I tried to push their limits playing Mannheim Steamroller's Tocatta which it handled effortlessly. Same with Tag Team's Whoomp! There it is! However, I noticed that while the bass notes can make your head shake, the mid-ranges are muffled and the high notes lack punch and a bit of sparkle to them. These are not audiophile-grade headphones. But then again, they were not intended to be!

Battery life: The rumors are true! It lasts a long, long time. The 30 hour estimate from the manufacturer is on the conservative rather than the optimistic side.

Comfort: The earcups allow me to wear them for around 4 hours intervals without any significant discomfort. The headband feels soft to the touch and they have a very distinctive black chrome look to them for those always important aesthetics thats gives them an air of sophistication. The buttons for volume are arranged in a confusing fashion, tho with down for upping the volume and viceversa.

Value: Excellent! There is no better mix of features, quality and affordability at any price point than this. When you factor in that to get better noise cancellation or sound quality you have to spend sometimes double or triple the cost of the E7s, then it becomes hard to justify spending more. These headphones may not be perfect, but they are perfect for me.

author: LG Moses
title: Noise Cancelling Works GREAT, Can't Hear the Kids!
content: First off, we have five kids. Our house is 1,000 total square feet and it's rarely quiet.  I bought these for my husband so he could watch videos, movies, or play games from his phone with out having to deal with the background noises of life. I didn't know they were so great until a few days ago when I was looking for him. I seriously looked in every room of the house and called his name several times... Eventually I found him when I was putting up laundry, hiding in the closet, watching a movie with the headphones on! He was baffled that he didn't hear me calling so we had to do a few tests to make sure it was the headphones and not selective listening. Sure enough, with the volume on medium, neither one of us could hear the other calling from one room away! For us this is an absolutely amazing benefit! My husband gets to come home from a busy day of work and tune out all of the chaos for a little while and then when it's my turn to get some down time by myself, I don't have to worry about hearing a random kid hollering or hooting and interrupting my Great British Bake Off.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good sound quality, but lacking in other areas
content:
Pros:
Good sound quality.
Noise cancellation is good enough to listen to audio books while operating loud machinery.
Noise cancellation is particularly good at zeroing out the sound of jet engines.
Battery seems to last a long time.
Bluetooth connection has good range.

Cons:
Need to be turned on in order to use the audio jack.
When using the audio jack, if the bluetooth connection is not disabled there will be an occasional pop noise.
More bulky and less comfortable than similar headphones.
I had to epoxy a plastic component in a jointed part of the headphones which broke off, leaving one ear piece dangling.
Noise cancellation fails to cancel out low frequency rumbling while driving on the freeway.

author: Ryan Geyer
title: Fantastic bluetooth over-ear headphones on a budget!
content:
First of all, I should say this: after a few months of use, my first pair completely stopped charging and became unusable, so I was understandably disappointed. However, I reached out to their customer service and within a week I had a brand new replacement pair, I couldn't be more satisfied with my experience there!

I'm glad I did get a replacement because I am a pretty big fan of these headphones. They're super comfortable and the battery life is incredibly good, even for someone like me who's a super heavy headphone user. The sound quality is also quite good, especially for a cheaper pair of bluetooth headphones!

If I had one complaint it would be the noise cancellation - it certainly leaves a lot to be desired. Not only does it produce a fairly noticeable drop in sound quality when it's turned on, it also doesn't feel like it blocks out a whole lot more background noise than when you're just listening in the regular non-noise cancelling mode. Although the headphones themselves do still block out a lot of sound, if you're specifically looking for really good noise cancelation, these may not be for you, but otherwise I'd definitely recommend them!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great bang for the buck, worth the buy if you want quality on a budget.
content:
After 5 months I can safely say that these headphones are a great bang for your buck if you are looking for a higher end feel without spending over a hundred bucks.

The sound quality is fairly good, but it’s not a breathtaking feeling when putting them on. Also, the noise canceling was a little disappointing if you’re looking for something to wipe out the sounds of a tv or busy office. However, if using them for music they do a fairly decent job of blocking out noise with the volume a decent way up, and the Bluetooth works great with anything that has a dedicated Bluetooth adapter or a mobile device.

The quality of the body is perfectly fine, and they’re great over large ears. After 5 months they are still comfortable and with decent care they’ve held up like new.

Overall it’s a 4.5 considering the price, but I still wouldn’t give it a 5 due to the lack of proper sound canceling and bass quality. Definitely worth the buy!

author: Nate
title: These headphones seem pretty great at first
content:
WHY AREN'T THERE MORE 1 STAR REVIEWS?
- I was offered a full refund on the condition that I delete this review. Keep that in mind when looking at the average rating.
------------------------------

These headphones seem pretty great at first. The sound quality is pretty good for the price, the noise cancelling works pretty well, and even the battery lasts pretty long.

So let's talk about what's not great...

First of all, the customer service from Cowin. I contacted them about this issue and heard nothing back, so it's time for an honest review.

These headphones suck, unless you're sitting still. They cannot withstand even the smallest amount of shock without cutting out. Riding the bus, walking too fast, you name it - they'll cut out. It's only for a fraction of a second, but when it happens every time the bus hits a small bump (not even a pothole) or when you start walking too fast (the harder you step the more they cut out) it gets pretty annoying.

I'll update this posting if customer service ever gets back to me. Perhaps I got a bad pair, but I've always taken care of them (I even bought a hard case for them and have never dropped them) so it's definitely no fault of my own that I own crappy headphones.

DON'T BUY THESE HEADPHONES IF YOU WANT ANY GUARANTEE THEY WILL WORK WELL.

author: Kate Kenworthy
title: Bad customer service
content: I sent these back.  I have great hearing aids and was very disappointed that I didn't have clarity when watching my TV.  Just didn't hear the high pitched sounds so good.  Then after a week, every time I tried to use them there was static and skipped words like you get on a bad cell phone call.  Very disappointed in these.  Nothing changed, they were bluetoothed to the TV and only the TV.  Sat fairly close.  I received a refund in August when I sent these back.  Now, in November I'm hearing from customer service and they said they wouldn't give me a refund unless I changed my review.  Idiots!!  As stated, I got my refund in August and I find it reprehensible that they would require me to lie about their product review.  After all, the purpose of these reviews is to give honest feedback so others can make an informed decision.  They tried to blackmail me into making a false review in order to get my refund but it backfired as I have already gotten it.

author: Raymond E Rowledge
title: Blue Tooth
content: I Decided too change my review I sent one headphone back that I was having a problem with and they were replaced it. Tec Support contacted me and wanted to know if there's anything they could do to resolve the issue. They were very helpful and supportive . Most the problem was because I was trying to connect up to different devices . Both of the headphones I have which are the  COWIN E7 Work really well Still have a little problem with connecting Bluetooth But that's because I'm constantly switching between devices. If you use the same device it will connects automatically . I do like the sound quality And The noise cancellation Works quite well even when I am  in the gym . Tease are excellent headphones for the price if you take care of them They should last you quite awhile .

author: Angelina
title: So far so good
content:
I just tried these out and so far I think the headphones are pretty alright. The sound quality is great, I think the noise-cancelling feature is pretty good. I'm trying out this pair and also SkullCandy's Crusher Wireless headphones, which is around $105-$150, to see which one I like better and here's what I've found:

- SOUND QUALITY: The sound quality is pretty much equal among both pairs. They sound slightly different, but I can't tell which one sounds better to me than the other. The sound quality slightly decreases in COWIN's pair when the noise-cancelling feature is turned off, but that's easily fixable by simply turning the feature on.
- NOICE-CANCELLING: Although COWIN's pair labels itself as noise-cancelling and SkullCandy's pair is more passive, I think the noise-cancelling feature among both pairs is almost equal. The only difference is that COWIN's sounds a bit like this soft fuzzy noise (like air) so I can actually *hear* noise-cancelling happening, and I have the option to turn it off and on. Turning it off slightly decreases the sound quality. With SkullCandy's pair, its noise-isolating feature is kind of like a default feature where I don't even need to turn the headphones on because the ear muffs are secure enough to my head that it blocks out enough noise on their own that it almost matches up with COWIN's pair's own noise-cancelling feature, which actually needs to be turned on. I like the noise-cancelling quality equally among both pairs, however I have a slight preference for COWIN's pair. When I wear the headphones and I talk and clear my throat, I can hear that the sound is more muffled out by COWIN.
- SOUND LEAKAGE: Both headphones have a tiny bit of sound leakage when I play my music at around 50%, however I've noticed that COWIN's pair leaks significantly more sound than SkullCandy's. I don't like it when people around me are able to hear what I'm listening to, especially since I'm a pretty anxious person, so this really has me leaning toward SkullCandy for now.
- DESIGN: I like the sleek-looking design of COWIN's pair, it looks more modern and overall aesthetically pleasing for me. The location of the volume buttons on the surface of the right ear muff is nice, although I think it's a little inconvenient that the volume-increasing button is on the bottom of the panel and the volume-decreasing button is up top, as opposed to the other way around. They also don't seem to work when I use them, so I have to adjust the volume on the device I'm connected to. I also don't really like how the power switch on COWIN's pair is on the very bottom of the hard part of the ear muff, it's a little difficult for me to find at times. With SkullCandy's pair, the buttons are on the backs of the ear muffs where a person typically puts their thumbs when they grab the ear muffs, so it's much easier to find those buttons without having to feel around.
- COMFORT: Although COWIN's pair also allows you to adjust the height of the ear muffs, it feels very loose compared to SkullCandy's pair. I think that's why it might have more sound leakage. When I wear COWIN's pair, it feels like it could fall off much easier both with the ear muffs and the area that fits around the top of my head. SkullCandy's pair feels much more secure, and their ear muffs don't wiggle around as much. They stay in place better and they fit my head and ears much more snugly. Because of this, SkullCandy's pair feels much more physically comfortable for me.
- OTHER NOTES: When you power the headphones on and off, I like the little high-tech beeps that I hear on COWIN's pair in comparison with SkullCandy's weird "power on/off" voice. This is just an aesthetic preference. SkullCandy's pair has adjustable bass though, so if you're listening to a song whose aesthetic lies strongly in its bass, I think SkullCandy's ability to let you adjust that really helps.
- PRICING: I think the overall quality has me leaning slightly more toward SkullCandy's Crusher Wireless pair, however the pricing for COWIN's pair is something I really can't ignore. For two pairs of headphones that are very similar in quality (in my opinion), the fact that COWIN is so much more affordable is what's giving me such a hard time really deciding which pair I want to keep and which one I'll end up returning.

I'll keep trying both of these headphones while I'm still inside the return window, so as I come up with new opinions, I'll be sure to update this review.

author: Daniel
title: First Defective, Now Perfect
content:
UPDATE: Jul 24, 2019
I have been in contact with customer support the last few days and they have decided to send me a replacement. The replacement is perfect, it would appear the original was defective. Thought it has been a year since it was ordered, the replacement came at the most amazing time-the headphones I were using had just broken.
The replacement pair they sent work absolutely perfectly.
Audio - 10/10
Noise Cancel - 8/10

The noise cancelling is not perfect, but it works very well.

Original Review:
First off, when writing reviews I make sure to give the product a thorough try first. At first, I had no real issue with it, then, today I went for a ride in the car trying out Noise Cancellation so I could hear my music over the engine.. The noise cancellation kept making a crackly "wind sound" as if it was damaged or something. I figured I would be able to hear it in the car well, but it does not work... I do not recommend this device if you actually want noise cancellation. The bluetooth [without it] is mediocre.

I am unsure what to do about it from here, it is having problems working so I don't know.

author: Buster
title: Great value
content: Wired headphones to my ears, have a better sound than blue tooth headphones.  Having said that, the Corwin E7s still have a pretty high sound quality and I prefer over the ear headphones to ear pods.  I can hear a difference when listening to speech, but with music, not so much.  I like to wear the Bluetooth headphones when I exercise, or am working in the garage or outside in the yard.  Or, any time where movement is involved and a wired headset can be restrictive.  I like to listen to all kinds of music (rock, jazz, blues, classical, techno, metal, etc.), mainly instrumental,  and usually connect them to streaming music stations on my iPhone.  They aren't a super light headset, but are very comfortable to wear for long periods.  Excellent overall frequency response, especially in the lower registers.  I don't know how long they will run on a charge, but I charge them once a week and have never had them go dead on me yet.  The noise canceling feature is ok.  It attenuates outside sound but not on a scale like a Bose, for example.  If that's important to you, then to get a little bit more noise canceling, be prepared to pay a lot more.
