Maybe I got a dud or something as I read many reviews and the consensus seemed to be that the mic was very good and clear. This is majorly unfortunate and I may end up needing to buy a mic for calls from my pc.

This is my first pair of bluetooth headphones and I haven't gotten one until now due to funds or fear of buying a bad pair and being stuck with an expensive headpiece lol. I am disappointed in the mic, but maybe the point is to not buy wireless medium level gear as the money is saved somewhere, but overall I am very happy with the headphones and would recommend to others who don't care about the mic.

author: Jessie S
title: Ok sounds good not that impressed though!
content: These are not sound resistant! I can still hear what’s going on around me sometimes if i pay attention or have it low enough. But I’m pretty satisfied with sound quality for the price.  I can hear the battery rattling around if I turn it up on maximum on some songs. The brand new one sounds better than the refurbished ones. I bought trying to save a few dollars. Another problem I hear the magnets bouncing around on any slightest bump. These are made for home use only! No Cars, buses, bikes,  running or ext. ya can hear these speakers or magnets bouncing around. But these do sound great just don’t move wearing these things or it rattles! Let’s see if the upgrade does this to on the more expensive models.

author: Kate Findel
title: Comfort, batterly life, bluetooth range & more are all AMAZING
content:
The headphones work great.
Comfort?
The way they're made is super comfortable. They don't squeeze your head or your ears or anything that would result in you having a headache. Instead they gently clasp onto your ears, super nice.
Battery life?
The battery life on these is superb. I would only charge mine once a week and even then I've never had these headphones die on me.
Bluetooth range?
The Bluetooth range on these blew me away. I can walk around my entire house without the loosing connection, even when the laptop is upstairs and I'm in the garage.
Delivery?
Arrived in two days. They come in a nice box that I use for storing them in as well as come with a faux leather case for travel.
COWIN company & warranties?
And COWIN support is amazing, I've used their headphones for a while, they will honor all warranties. One of my old (like really old) headphones broke a while ago way past the 18 month warranty, and they still replaced mine and even upgraded me to a newer version for free. The lady who helped me gave me her phone number to text for any other questions or anymore help. So I'm definitely loyal to their brand. Great company all around.

author: James Hutchins
title: Not For Headbangers
content:
Well, this is the first pair of blu-tooth headphones I've ever purchased and so my complaints aren't necessarily directed at this specific make and model but, I suppose, at the kind of headphones these are. These are extremely frustrating headphones for a person who is used to simply plugging in a pair of headphones and listening to whatever they wish. That, apparently isn't how these type of headphones work. No, these need to be charged constantly, just like a smart phone, and they will not work if you bang your head. Now, if you're like me - I am a punk and metal head, and when I listen to music, I tend to bob my head up and down... but this device is not made with that in mind, every time I bang my head (let's say in the downward motion) the sound cuts off. Extraordinarily frustrating for me.

I now know that I will never again purchase a pair of blu-tooth headhones again, as they do not do what I want them to do unless my head is remaining perfectly still - for example, when I watch Game of Thrones or something - but will not work when listening to the music that I enjoy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great product and customer service
content: Great product

author: Joe
title: Garbage Reviews, Garbage Headphones -- I want my money back.
content:
I don't normally time to write reviews, but for these headphones I'll make an exception.  Let me start by pointing out that the vast majority of the reviews giving these headphones five stars are fake.  If you don't believe me, check fakespot for yourself.

Now on to the headphones (for full disclosure, I should point out that I'm comparing these against a pair of Sony WH-CH700N, which I just picked up for $89.99 so I'm comparing them to a better pair of cans, but not a comically better pair.)  The Sony are, to put it mildly, vastly superior.  The first thing that jumps out at me is the construction and design.  The Cowin's feel cheap and poorly constructed, like they'll break if not used gingerly.  The Sony headphones are much better engineered and you can feel it.  The slide is better, the material is stronger and unlike the Cowin's. they actually stay on my head when getting up out of a recliner.

I'm not an audiophile, but I now understand why people are.  Listening to the Sony headphones after using the Cowin, I'm shocked at how much clearer and better my music sounds.

As for noise cancellation, the Cowin's make some weird background humming.  It makes the mediocre sound quality outright unbearable.  I don't really care about this because I don't use noise cancellation, but if that's your thing, be warned.

Finally,  bluetooth range.  My Cowin's start breaking up after about 6-7 feet.  For reference I just tested the Sony headphones and was able to walk 25 feet away without so much as a hiccup.

Do yourself a favor, don't waste your money on these poorly designed headphones.  You'll just end up with buyer's remorse like me, wanting your money back.

author: Sean Pearson
title: Cheaply made, headphones I buy at CVS last longer.
content: Two of my coworkers in the office like theirs, but I must have gotten a bad pair. In less than 3 months the left ear is already having issues crackling on/off. Not to mention, both ears broke off, so I have been holding them together with rubber bands since month two. I sit in an office all day, not like I'm being rough with these or dropping them. These are truly the worst headphones I've ever had, and ironically more than I usually spend.

author: Talena
title: Good audio, great customer service
content:
Edit 9/5/19: Customer service reached out to me and is replacing them, they allowed me to choose a sturdier looking pair. Which I think is amazing. I am raising my review for that. Because they are standing behind their product. Which does foster a confidence in them and the product.

The sound was good. The noise canceling gave him a headache. And one of the ear cup things rotated way too far around immediately when he got it. But he thought it was supposed to and never told me until he had had it for a few months and one day asked me why the one turned so much and the other didn't and I looked at it and it was broken. And very shortly after that he fell asleep sitting on the couch wearing them, it slid off his head, and the broken cup finished breaking.

The sound quality would be worth the money if the construction were decent.

We threw them away months ago. And I just ran in to the box and got annoyed cause school is about to start and he needs another headset. Guess what I'm not buying? These.

author: R. Pinckney
title: Cowin E-7, very impressed!!!
content: I bought a pair of these headphones about a month ago for my wife bc her old headphones had broke across the headband. After several months of watching her glue old pair, I decided to surprise her with a new pair. I was looking for a noise canceling pair for her to listen to audio books while I watch sporting events in bedroom. I chose the E-7 bc of the many reviews, over 2500, also about 80% positive customer ratings. The price range was excellent too, @$70.  I'm not sure why ppl spent $200-300 on a pair of headphones. However, I was a little skeptical bc I hadn't heard of this Cowin brand. But I decided to go with it. I was slightly impressed once they arrived w/ the way they were packed in it's box. After my wife charged them I decided to try them out listening to music on my phone while she was at work. 👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽 for the quality of sound, nice deep bass but not too overwhelming on the ears!! 👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽 for comfort & look. I guess my only problem...I've been wearing them more than my wife. My wife has advised me that she wants her own pair of Cowin E-7. I ditched my SkullCandy brand & only use them to cut grass now. So I'll be ordering another pair really soon. The noise canceling works great w normal level noises & surrounding conversations. Battery life is awesome in my opinion too. Oh also Cowin stands behind their product w a 18 month warranty.

author: Horacemann
title: For the price these are hard to beat
content:
I’ve owned and used these for about a month and are the first pair of noise canceling Bluetooth headphones I’ve owned. I’ve not used Bluetooth headphones or earbuds by other manufacturers so can only speak about my experience with this product.

Arrived charged so these can be used fresh out of the box. All cables for charging and connecting via 1/8” audio cable included and they paired quickly and easily with my IPhone. The ear pieces are very soft and fit snuggly but not too tight. I used these on two 12-hour flights and they still had a charge.

The audio quality is good with a rich, deep base and high notes that aren’t  tinny. These do not completely cancel outside noises/sounds but reduces significantly.

There’s a tiny blue LED light that glows when these are powered on. It would be nice if this could be deactivated since it’s very bright and distracting in a dark room.

author: S. Loveland
title: Received a replacement
content: Good sound quality on the replacement.  However the quality as just as poor as the first pair.

author: Mike Feldmeier
title: Unexpectedly Fantastic
content:
I'm a programmer and like to focus without distraction.  I was using earbuds plugged into my phone to cancel out the random voices around my office, which I would have to max out to block out maybe 80% of the noise.  Meanwhile, I'm sure I was causing hearing damage.

I didn't want to pay two or three hundred dollars for the expensive ones, so I went with these based on price and reviews.  I wasn't expecting them to be this nice though.

They arrived on time.  They come in a heavy cardboard box with foam cutouts usually assocated with higher tier electronics.  They are attractive and are the perfect weight.  Not too heavy, but heavy enough to feel substantial.  They wrap around your head with every contact point cushioned and soft.  They literally feel like they are hugging your head.  After charging at home, I turned them onto the noise cancelling setting.  My home office is a fish room, with air pumps, bubbling aquariums, and a set of overly noisy computer fans.  I could still hear them, but they were now relegated to being sounds far and away.  They could have been outside from how they sounded.  Then I paired the headphones with my phone and played a few songs (mostly cinematic instrumentals for concentration purposes).  The sound is simply amazing.  The deep notes and strings come through beautifully.  All of the tinniness is gone, and you feel surrounded by the music instead of it being injected into your head.  In addition, I am able to listen to it at half of the volume that I had it set at.  This was a great investment!

author: Amazonsaurus
title: Best Headphones for a Good Price
content:
I'm a normal guy who uses headphones for listening to music and not having to talk to people. so here's my review:

They look amazing, like quite expensive look and the little blue light next to the buttons adds a futuristic gadget touch. (fingerprints tend to happen a lot in the shiny parts) I know they make my co-workers jealous.

They sound amazing, I notice no difference while having them plug-in or via bluetooth.

The only difference is when I turn on the noise cancelling function, outside noise does get cancel out like 50%, but once you turn on the music is 100%, cant hear a thing. Fire Alarms,Sirens, Nuclear Warnings cant reach me, wear them in a safe place.

I got them on a wednesday and charge them that day.
I use them at the office:

Thursday-Friday use
Week 2 Monday-Friday use
Week 3 Monday-Friday use

Until Week 4 on Monday had to charge them, battery life is amazing.

About the comfort, not heavy and they feel very soft on your ears, but I kinda need to adjust them quite a bit for my left ear.
Buy a case for them. they come with a bag, but that doesnt protect them if you drop the bag or something fells on it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Comfortable but Bluetooth connectivity not entirely reliable.
content:
These headphones produce more bass than a much older corded set that I own, but I think that bass is excessive compared to true flat sound reproduction.  These headphones are fairly comfortable to wear.  The Bluetooth wireless connection function works, but can be confused if the headphones are used first paired with a TV and then brought near a PC that happens to have Bluetooth.  And if paired with that PC, and thereafter attempted to be used with the TV to which they were previously paired, there may be some difficulty clearing the previous pairing and re-pairing.  Even the original pairing with my 2017 TV was not immediately successful, and instead required several tries despite no other Bluetooth devices anywhere in range.  The range of the Bluetooth function of these headphones appears to be rather variable, sometimes working beyond 30 ft while at many others not working reliably when only 10 ft from the source to which they are paired.

Corded function also requires the battery within these headphones to be charged.  And the headphones must be turned off in order to recharge.  Thus, if the battery runs low while listening using the Bluetooth function, you cannot simply connect these headphones directly to your TV or PC via the min--jack cord and continue to listen.

You need to remember to turn off the power when finished using these headphones or the battery will likely be drained when you pick them up the next day to use them.

author: Brendan J Tierney
title: Overall Very Satisfied
content:
First of all, I'd like to say that when I bought this product, I kept in mind the wireless ability, noise cancelling feature, price, then quality, in that order. They also have an inline mic that is not the greatest. I didn't get this for the mic though. I mostly use this for casual use since I've gotten tired of wires trippin' out on me.

1. Appearance 7/10 - It's made of plastic. It feels cheap but that's also a benefit, since it is quite light on the head. It came in a nice box with a microUSB - USB charger, slightly shorter than 2 feet. It does not come with a bag or anything to hold it, so if you're looking to have something to put it in for carrying, you'll have to get that separately. I bought a wireless bluetooth adapter to plug into my laptop, and while the sound won't go through thick walls or around corners easily, I'm plenty happy to have it at maximum quality while I'm in my room.
2. Sound Quality 7/10 - They have average sound quality. It doesn't get too bassy, and it's not too rough on the higher frequencies. I've used these headphones for some music mastering and they do an okay job (they pass on music editing but they're not that great), but they should be perfectly fine for casual use. There is a slight decrease in performance when the noise cancelling is turned on but it's not that noticeable to me. By using the cable that comes with the device, you can get a wired connection. I haven't noted any significant increase in performance by wiring it up though, and the microUSB - USB that comes enclosed does not do a great job of keeping the connection stable for wired listening. However, the cable provides a decent enough connection to charge. You buy these things for the wireless capability anyways.
3. Noise Cancelling 8/10 - The great part is the noise cancelling part. My bathroom is rather close to my room, but I can turn on the fan and then turn on the noise cancelling and it reduces the noise by a ton. Unfortunately, it won't reduce noise like bed-springs coming from the room above me.
4. Battery Life 9/10 - I've had these headphones for a little over a month now, and I can say that the battery life seems to be doing okay. You see, there isn't a great indicator of battery life on these things. FYI When fully charged the red light at the base of the headphones will turn off, and when they run out of battery they emit a sad sound after you try to power it up before it dies again. After having forgotten to charge the headphones for a few days, my estimate is that they last for about 25 hrs on bluetooth. I haven't checked the battery life with the noise cancelling on, but I would suspect around 10 hrs.
5. Comfort 6/10 - Well honestly, they're a nice balance for me. They feel comfortable around the ears and all, and the material surrounding the ears is nice. However, it should be noted that these headphones do tend to feel a bit tight. It doesn't bother me too much because if I have them on for that long, then I feel that it is a good health indicator to myself that I've probably been wearing them for too long.
6. Durability - I'm not quite too sure on this point. I've noticed that sometimes switching it off doesn't quite switch it off and it tries to connect. I've gotten around this point by flipping it all the way to noise cancelling, then going back to switch it to off. Sometimes that works, sometimes it doesn't. I get the feeling that it might be related to a low battery since it has only happens then, but I'm not certain. The headset itself is quite durable.

I recommend this to anyone on a slightly lower budget that can't afford those top end wireless headphones. I think these are a great deal for the price, and definitely recommend.

author: Artem
title: Good headphones especially at this price point. The only con is too quiet.
content:
pros:
- well balanced sound like bass/tremble, etc - sounds pretty great to me.
- movies, music and video games sound better than my last 2-3 headphones.
- Comfortable
- Premium feel

Cons:
- Not loud enough over the bluetooth on my PC. But noise cancellation basically ensures that you'll hear everything, it's just that level of immersion is lost for when you want extra loudness in a movie of a video game. You'll hear everything, but it'll be unrealistically quiet breaking the immersion if that makes sense.
I would have returned headphones without noise cancellation that are so quiet, but because of noise cancellation it kind of works. And other pros outweigh this one con.

Imagine your TV have a volume and you have like 20 bars and sometimes you want to set it at 15, but this TV malfunctioned and only allows you to set it at 13 max? That's basically what's missing for me when it comes to volume for these headphones. Most of the time for casual things it works great.

author: Praveen
title: Good headset for the price segment
content:
Packaging and unboxing:
Thumbs up on this one. The contents inside were well packaged and padding to protect from shock was well done. Check my pics for unboxing.

Only thing that could have been better is if I had a hard case instead of leather pouch.

Material and finish:
I love the finish of the headphone. It looks classy. The metals add to the look as well as serves as hardware switch for volume

Audio and experience:
Bass is great. Fits right only your ears with right pressure (tight fit causes sense of itchy and sweaty sensation over ears after prolonged wear) so I was finding it comfortable listening to music for long time.

It is not noise cancelling as much as I thought(i could hear tv audio in my living room) but definitely cuts ambient noise. Overall, a good set to own

author: Travis F.
title: Very comfortable and light weight
content:
First and foremost, let me preface my review with the fact that I purchased (and returned) my first pair of COWIN E-7 headphones due to quality control issues including muffled sound and low volume on the left channel. Within an hour of posting my original 2-star review, COWIN reps reached out to me to address my concerns. After a few messages, and understanding that I had already returned the original pair I had purchased on Amazon, Joey from COWIN issued me a complimentary pair described as being "higher quality" for my review. I was not certain if this would mean E-7 v2.0 or just a replacement of what I had previously purchased. After receiving the replacement product, I believe it implied a replacement of the same version but one that lacked the quality control-related issues as was observed with the first pair.

Based on my experience thus far, COWIN's customer support is unbelievably good. If I were rating my review on this interaction alone, they would definitely receive 5-star review. However, this is a product review, so there are many other factors to be considered.

Audio Reproduction Quality: 3.5 / 5
Overall, audio sounds warm, bassy, and not as crisp as some of its competitors. With Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) disabled, external noises are amplified, creating an echo chamber-like experience, indicating a sound leak. I believe this is due to less padding and smaller ear cups when compared to other similar products in the same price bracket. That being said, I would rate the audio quality as slightly above average. Engaging the ANC feature seems to muffle or dampen the audio like having a wet towel over your head between you and the audio source.

Comfort: 4 / 5
The light weight construction is the main factor that determined how I felt about the comfort level of these headphones. I'm a bigger guy with a larger head. While the ear cups fit nicely, I feel that increasing the thickness of the ear cup would go a long way in terms of comfort and reducing the level of audio leak.

Appearance / Aesthetics: 4 / 5
From the piano black finish to the chrome, the COWIN E-7's look pretty sharp from a distance. Up close, you realize the set is mostly plastic, but material choice plays a huge factor in weight and comfort. They definitely have an above-average appearance.

Battery: 5 / 5
Battery life seems to last for the claimed time. Supposedly, it is also replaceable which is definitely a plus.

Interface / Getting Started / Ease of Use: 5 / 5
It appeared as though the box lid was improperly cut/sized but this is about headphones, which were well protected during shipment. Among the easiest bluetooth headphones I've used when it comes to pairing. There didn't seem to be any special button pressing required. I simply turned them on and scanned for them on my devices. Instructions are included in the bottom of the box. Perhaps my favorite feature on this headphone set is the lack of obnoxious audio notices that are sometimes present when adjusting the volume, indicating battery levels at various stages, or accompanying power functions.

Connectivity: 4.5 / 5
Bluetooth is limited to roughly 10 meters in ideal environmental conditions. This will generally imply a clear line-of-sight (LOS) in an outdoor environment away from any metal or bodies of water that can impede performance. When compared to my other bluetooth devices in the same environment, the COWIN E-7's performed well, on par with other similar bluetooth products.

NOTE: DISCORD USERS -- THE INABILITY TO PLAY AN AUDIO TRACK WHILE CONNECTED TO A VOICE CHANNEL IS A FAULT WITH DISCORD, NOT THE BLUETOOTH AUDIO DEVICE.

author: Amy W
title: OK product - poor, nonexistent customer support
content:
I bought these in April, worked great. Nice soft case included, solid battery life before a charge is needed. Comfortable.  Sound is OK. I can hear office noise around me, but it's not terrible. (i.e. Not exactly Noise Cancelling.) OK for the price. Customer Support is poor. In September my Aux cord stopped working. No Sound. Warranty for headphones is for eighteen (18) months. I emailed customer support and followed all the troubleshooting instructions they suggested. I was told my cord would be replaced if needed. After troubleshooting (charging, bluetooth check, cleaning, swapping out cords) realized the original Aux Cord was faulty. I replied to Support again with the results asking for the warranty to be covered for the Aux Cord. I immediately got bounce back emails. (6-8 Bounce backs "Recipient inbox full"; several days in a row) Also, the support phone number on the website goes straight to voice mail; No professional identification as Cowin on the voice recording and tells me I've reached "xxx-xxx-xxxx" - a completely different number than the Support# listed. Who knows who is at the number listed. I've not been able to reach Cowin since.

UPDATE Got an email from Cowin customer service, October 2018: "Thank you for your interest in our replacement parts but we are not selling/replacing them. We are very sorry for this discrepancy, But the only solution is to find another aux cable in your local tech store or amazon!"

author: TXLA
title: First impression: Good sound/value
content:
These are the nicest headphones I’ve owned because I never could justify spending hundreds of dollars on those fancy ones. I’m a very casual music listener—usually in the car or sometimes via Bluetooth speakers at home. I bought these to listen to music on my phone and possibly take while traveling. I love my bass-heavy music and EDM, so I wanted something decent sounding. These are very decent and good for sixty bucks. I tried listening to a couple of popular film scores, pop, hip hop, dance, rock, and a headphone testing video off YouTube. These headphones sound clear, have a good stereo sound effect, and decent enough bass (better than the ones from five below and better than Apple EarPods). I played around with the EQ settings and there are noticeable differences. None of them have the extreme bass sound of the Skullcandy Crusher headphones but this one is cleaner/crisper sound for all genres.

My eleven year old son and my husband were both pleasantly surprised at the sound quality and appearance of these headphones. The packaging is beautiful and feels expensive. I like the pleather storage pouch it came with and that it was packed nicely without too much wasteful wrapping etc.

Considering these are plastic I can see why some people’s sets broke within a year; I think if these are kept in one spot (like just at home or just at work, etc) as opposed to traveling a lot with them, they could potentially last longer. I hope to mostly keep them at home so I’ll see if this works. I’ll also update after travel and some time.

author: James Drury
title: Hard to beat at this price
content:
The Cowin E-7 headphones deliver excellent value.  The headphones are very comfortable to wear for hours at a time and provide good sound quality. The Bluetooth connection lets you wander around (not too far, but that's typical for wireless). You can also use as a WIRED headphone to save battery life.

The Noise Cancellation works. Low frequencies disappear so car trips are a little quieter.  You'll still hear higher frequencies but even my $300 headset won't cut out all outside noise.  At this price the functionality is as good as it gets.

The only problem I can find... and I have to look hard... is the microphone.  There is just a little pinhole mic on the headset.  Your voice can sound hollow or distant.  It definitely works and is usable for Skype or other VoIP calls but it is not as good as a boom-style mic found in "communication" headsets.  These were purchased primarily for listening and not for chatting so I won't delete any stars.

We haven't tested the full battery life but have used these for several hours without any problems. If you want a sub $100 headset with noise cancellation then this would be a good place to start.

author: Moe Jallad
title: The Hardware is not good - UPDATE!! read update 09/26/2019
content:
I use it for work only, we have an open space office setup and I needed something to cancel out the noises in the background. I have a desk job 8-5 so no gaming no jumping around. this thing broke in less than a year for what I used it for I think that was very quick, had to tape it and change the tape once a month (check photos)

on all fairness its not all bad news, it is very comfortable once it was working, the noise canceling feature is decent it is no Sony but its not $250  either.

overall I liked it - if it was not for the cheap plastic that broke that would have been a solid 5 starts but the headset falling apart makes it unusable.

Update 09/26/2019 - so these guys called me and refunded me, I never asked for a refund and I never contacted them on the count of I used it for more than few months but nevertheless they contacted me so if yours break give them a call you might get a new one - another thing the lady told me they have revised and it should be better now. so my take on this is the following: 5star service and possibly 5star for the revised version.

author: E. Simpson
title: Perfect for travel
content: I used this for the long haul between Tampa and San Diego and then back, and was really pleased with its performance on the trip. Bluetooth has been excellent, and on the plane I just plugged it in to the port for the in flight entertainment.

author: JAMES B. REED
title: Elegant Set of Headphones with Great Sound and Comfortable to Wear
content: This is elegant set of headphones for a very reasonable price! I use them with my computer and they sound great. They were easy to pair with my computer via Bluetooth. They are easy to adjust and they cancel out background noise extremely well. The headphones are comfortable to wear and the quality of sound is excellent.  I am happy with this purchase and I would recommend them to others.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cradle your ears in comfort
content:
After I figured out how to connect it to my desktop, using the recommended USB Bluetooth adapter (mini-CD included), I am very happy with it. I use it for news, streaming videos, and, of course, music. After years of tripping over a headphone cord, this is blissful freedom. It's light and quite comfortable. I don't use the NC mode, it's not what I want and not using it, gives me much longer use per charge. I know there are better ones out there, but for use with my computer, this is near perfect.
Update: Still happy with the very comfortable E7 headphones. What I did not expect was that the moment I departed the room, things got very shaky and audio broke up or went dead entirely, until I reentered the room where the computer is located. Also, with distance, maybe 25 feet, they became directionally unstable, i.e. if I bent down to pick something up, the audio would break up. Same when I turned my head one way or the other.  I don't know if that's typical or just this particular headset. It may even be the ZEXMTE adapter that's the bottleneck. I can't tell without buying another brand and comparing it.

author: Ashley and Martin
title: Sound isn't perfect, but they're super helpful
content:
I got these so I could have some over-ear headphones to use at work to block out office noise and focus. They work great over Bluetooth and using the included audio cable - in fact, you can use both at the same time, i.e. have it plugged into my desktop PC and connected to my phone via Bluetooth.

I've never used active noise cancelling headphones before this, I wasn't sure what exactly was supposed to be filtered out. It filters out rhythmic noise - fans, air conditioning, hard drive spinning, etc. If you have nothing playing, it actually makes other sounds like speech more distinct, albeit quieter due to covering your ears.

One other thing. If you have them turned on and paired to your phone, then take them off, you won't hear your phone ring because it goes to the headphones. I've missed a couple calls because of this. I started turning them off when I take them off for more than a minute or so.
